cnRicoü¶Ñ[Neris¬π‚Å∞Jin¬π¬≤Charon¬≥] -7 24-06-2024 21:34
# BEGIN: Sum of Her Parts (Yozuki's Arc) (edited)
üëÄ 2
DM [Ricochet] BOT 27-06-2024 18:09
It is time for your assessment. Such was the content of the missive Yozuki received in her laboratory late last night. A knock, and a note. No signature. No directions. Just a statement. It's almost poetic that today is the day of the [Summer Solstice](https://discord.com/channels/905604470644285460/1050653630136586270/1255673959551078411), the longest day of the year. What a day to call the construct out from her basement laboratory into to what passes for one of the most beautiful days of the year. The air is cool with a light breeze, and there has been no rain in several days, so the ground is less muck and more actual ground. It is a day worth celebrating. Whether the day turns out to be a celebration remains to be seen. The Blue Water Inn is more full than usual, and Danika is slinging drinks and hearty meals to the best of her ability. But there is room enough for one more group...
üëÄ 1
Whizzerd BOT 27-06-2024 18:51
Whizzerd is sitting at one of the tables eating a large plate of meat and potatoes. Having taking some time off of adventuring, he has been in high sprints as of late. Most of the crystals scorning his body have greatly diminished, leaving only a couple medium and small shards embedded in his forearms and chest. As he sits he can‚Äôt help but be reminded of the promise he made to Yozuki, about finding her sister. Whizzerd isn‚Äôt too sure what occurred between them but what he is sure about is that they‚Äôll be able to work it out. Barovia is a harsh place to live so having someone who can watch your back is a godsend.
Yozuki BOT 27-06-2024 20:10
Chaos. It's the only constant present in the iron dame's readings of two things: How the magic in Whizzerd's crystals work, and the arcane weave signature reader tuned to find one very specific automaton, her other self. Scratch that. Make that three, as whoever wrote the note struggled with it to keep the writing legible. This bug in the system, this chaos in the immaculate, it can only mean one thing. One thing only. One, two, three, four mechanical birdlings would fly out to the scarcely clear skies of Vallaki that day. One for Yuki Northernfur the shifter, one for Redfeather the survivor of Dok'Ua. The both of them had sworn their participation for this very day, and it is time to make good of it. One bird flies far for a kobold mender and arena legend she's never met before. Her last adventure with Thurrim and the other dragonkin has left in her a great longing and desire to see it once more: the true strength which lies in a dragon's heart. Besides, what this party needs is a mender perfectly capable of defending themself. Now's the time to leave it up to chance if this reclusive legend would join them. The last bird just flew in to Blue Water Inn, landing directly besides Whizzerd's meal. Carried by its iron beak is the message similarly written for Yuki and Redfeather as well.
"Meet us in Blue Water Inn, the time has come" Y P.S. The bird will self-destruct in 10 seconds after this message is received.
*Beep beep beeeeeeeeeep.* (edited)
3
‚≠ê 6
Zee BOT 27-06-2024 20:34
*The kobold reads the mechanical birdling. Of course it is in Common. Instead of spending the past few years perfecting his Common, he spent that time practicing the Tongue of Sun and Moon technique. After all, why learn one language when you could tap into the weave and completely bypass language altogether? But the Tongue of Sun and Moon requires a mind and does not worth with a written message. He parses each letter and translates each word, often having to go back and read the prior words multiple times to understand the phrase. He gets to about "10 seconds" before the bird starts to smoke and turn to ash*
ü§£ 4
Whizzerd BOT 27-06-2024 20:55
Whizzerd spots the mechanical bird and reads the letter taking his time to look over it. ‚ÄúHuh, I was just thinking of them!‚Äù Whizzerd said happily as he brings the bird closer to his face to examine it, ‚ÄúWait, what does self destr-‚Äú Whizzerd question was interrupted as the bird started to sputter and smoke. In a rare case of intelligence, Whizzerd realizes what the bird will do and quickly rushes out of the inn, bird in hand. ‚ÄúGot to get rid of this, but where exactly?‚Äù As Whizzerd looks around before quickly looking at the rift forming above Barovia. Whizzerd unceremoniously chucks the bird bomb to the rift, batting it with his sword for extra ommph as he sends Yozuki‚Äôs messenger at the hag.
ü§£ 4
2
‚≠ê 5
Yuki Northernfur BOT 28-06-2024 03:58
Summer. Summer in Barovia is like an exhibition of black and white paintings in which some artist barges in and exclaims: ‚ÄúHey guys!! I discovered a new shade of grey!!‚Äù Underwhelming is an understatement. The usually grey sky, still grey, just pisses on them less. Which is great, let‚Äôs be real. It allows passage to otherwise ever-muddy areas around Lake Zarovich, so Yuki can find an isolated spot to fish and think. A small fire is burning besides him, a pot full of freshly-caught fish stew resting over the flame. Lunch will be good today. His last conversation with Yozuki plays in his mind in a perpetual loop. He analyses it, thinks of better ways he could have made a positive impact, reprimands himself for his lack of insight. Like a teenager looking back at how his interaction with his crush‚Äôs mom went. But all in all, he knows that the time is nigh, and he needs to get ready, both physically and mentally, to get out there and look for Asahi. Something about her not being there anymore doesn‚Äôt sit right with him. As the thoughts course through his mind, a bird lands near him. This isn‚Äôt new to him; as a shifter, his closeness with animals makes them lean towards trusting him. But this one is different. It vibrates to him, like a dozen hummingbirds joined forces to try and make as much noise as possible. That‚Äôs when it hits him: this is not a natural bird. It has a message in its beak. Yuki takes it, brows frowned. Who could this be? The bird is entirely made of metal, but otherwise mimics the movements and behavior of birds impressively well. The message looks like this. (edited)
Kami | Yuki¬π¬≤ | JST +9 28-06-2024 03:58
https://imgur.com/6mPC8hx
2
ü§£ 3
‚≠ê 3
AM
Yuki doesn‚Äôt need to read it. He doesn‚Äôt want to. This would take so much out of him, he‚Äôd be ready for a long rest after this. But as he stares at the horrendous handwriting that could only be Yozuki‚Äôs, the small bird starts to hiss like a kettle starting to warn that its insides are hot. Without even looking at it, Yuki takes the lid of his stew pot and puts it on the bird. The latter soon goes PPFFH! and the lid is lifted a foot or so above the ground, now slightly black from the contained detonation. Yuki lifts the lid and looks at the scattered pieces of metal, then at the message in his hand. ‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù he asks himself. ‚ÄúWhy would she self-destruct the bird? Isn‚Äôt the message the important part?‚Äù But he has learned. He has learned not to ask questions about the twins or their motives. They always have a reason, and even if it isn‚Äôt ‚Äúcommon sense‚Äù, it is still somehow logical. As logical as a child building a trap out of wooden toys and strings to catch a burglar. Nevertheless, he stands up, and gathers his things. He tastes his stew; not quite there yet, but it‚Äôd be a waste to throw it away, so he eats as much of it as his body will allow. He then quickly cleans everything, and puts all tools and utensils back in his Bag of Holding. He departs for the Blue Water Inn. Not because he read it from the message, but because that‚Äôs where he saw Yozuki last. It takes him a while and a half, but he finally enters the inn and immediately spots her. She is not alone, forming a group around herself. .
AM
First, the lady in question. Yozuki is sitting as though she‚Äôd be the textbook representation of what proper posture should look like. She is talking with and being a great host to the ones around her, hands on her lap in old-fashioned form, her demeanor lacking anything that would hint towards her being eager or in a hurry to find her second half. But Yuki knows better. Her connections are most likely torn inside, not quite knowing what the best course of action is. Then, a huge half-orc. Yuki believes he has talked with him once, a long time ago, but that would (if even accurate) be the extent of their relationship. Can‚Äôt even remember the name. But he‚Äôll play it cool. It‚Äôs got to come up in conversation at some point. Yuki comes in and walks towards the table. ‚ÄúHey, Yoz. I got your‚Ä¶.‚Äù he doesn‚Äôt finish his sentence as he almost trips on a small creature. A kobold it there, almost lost in the chaotic buzz of the inn. Yuki recognizes him, though he isn‚Äôt too personal on the info. He fought with this kobold during a sticky situation in some cave or basement or whatnot. Spiders everywhere. He‚Äôs surprised but seemingly favorable towards the apparition. This small thing was an amazing asset back then, and surely he would be now as well. ‚ÄúI got your‚Ä¶ message,‚Äù he continues, feeling more at ease now that he has confirmed he knew the people around. ‚ÄúIt is time, isn‚Äôt it. How are you feeling about the whole thing? Are you ready to give it your all?‚Äù he asks, eyebrows frowned in a perplexed expression.
1
‚≠ê 2
Whizzerd BOT 28-06-2024 04:57
It wasn‚Äôt long for other people to arrive to the bar. The first one Whizzerd recognizes is Yozuki, who he gives a warm smile to. ‚ÄúI hope that crystal I gave you helped a bit,‚Äù Whizzerd said as he took a seat at the table, ‚ÄúSo how are we doing this reunion?‚Äù Whizzerd looks at Yuki and gives a a nod, ‚ÄúI believe we met before, the board game right?‚ÄùWhizzerd says, though he unfortunately forgot the man‚Äôs name it should be fine. It has to come up at some point. As Whizzerd talks the two who have met him notice a big change, that being his speech. Compared to the almost cloudy stupor he was in before, the half-orc before them was much more present and coherent.
Zee BOT 28-06-2024 12:04
*Zee's short stature lets him hide his wine glass from the bar staff. It is a magical wine glass from Blood on the Vine, and he thinks the Inn would prefer that he not bring in outside drink. The Kobold is enjoying the company of the group. He is finding himself genuinely happy. The act of speaking in his native language and everyone being able to understand him makes him feel like less of an outsider. Both the people who he has traveled with and the ones who are new are friendly and agreeable. He has not yet discovered the purpose of the meeting, but he doesn't much care.*
1
Brocc[Redfeather10/Chronn6] -8 28-06-2024 12:23
Redfeather's claws have worn a deep groove in the floorboards from pacing. He prowls ceaselessly in a tight circle- scribbling all the while. "Not efficient enough! Not matter if have another heart! Stupid bird wasting own time! BAH! Angrily he kicks a nearby pot- smashing it's half formed contents against the far wall. This sudden motion causes him to loose balance and collapse to a knee- hacking violently. Reflexively the kenku draws an Injector full of Stimulants and plunges it into his chest. Quickly he rights himself before immediately starting to pace again. "Yes blood- BLOOD! HOW I NOT SEE IT BEFORE!? Where else secrets lie?! HahahHAAHAHAAAA!" Redfeather pauses, shaken from his distraction. He squints up at the bird with confusion. Having not slept in... hmm... it's hard to tell if this sudden unexpected element is real. He gently takes the message, inspects it, and gasps shocked as it burns away in his claws. Beneath his feathers a cold sweat flashes over him. "What If it's a trap ever think of that?" "SHUT UP YOU!" The kenku glares at the thing sitting hunched in the dark patch of his nest. It barely fits- a bloated black beast coiled tightly just beyond his little circle. It's red eyes blaze with mirth "WHY NOT BE USEFUL! MAYBE FIGURE OUT HOW YOUZKI PURIFY PHOSPHEROUS??" The barrel fashioned into a door slams shut behind him The patrons of the inn are startled by a loud bang as the door slams open. Redfeather bursts in, fully prepared to open fire, and finds neither yozuki or any of her enemies... So he removes his hand from within the baggy jacket and skitters in warily. Then he spots yuki Scratch that. "SHIFTER! It been long time." A black blur he skids to a stop to glower up at the taller humanoid. An all to familiar sight but... somethings off. He's bigger. Perhaps fitter? It's difficult to tell beneath the suit and some bandages about his chest. "Bone to pick with!" "I the bird- why you chicken out?" (edited)

What are you even doing here?‚Äù

HE WHAT?! This takes him completely by surprise, and he doesn't know what to reply. "You... You're a.... wh... I'm.... sorry for your kid...." He doubles back. "I mean... congrats?... What the hell...."

Yozuki BOT 28-06-2024 13:32
Yozuki herself came in shortly after Whizzerd has punted he bird to alchemy-knows-where. Wow, she only sent that bird less than a minute ago and no doubt the half orc has travelled from as far away as the other side of the realm to meet her request. Such eagerness. One, two, three... out of four. Good. Almost perfect attendance, certainly thanks to her meticulously crafted and very easy to understand message. Wasn't it convenient? You can just throw it away after you're done admiring the beautiful handwriting, there's also ample time to read the message then throw the bird. Surely these intelligent people she picked for the job understood the assignment. Magnificent. She was about to provide some explanation but then there's the loud crash along with the open door. Redfeather. The questions that ensues, the confusion that lingers after, she would answer in one loud clap. Metal to metal. BANG. > "How joyous. Familiarity among each other. Efficient. Mr. Zee, we presume? There is plenty of context to disclose but we shall endeavour to maintain brevity." From one of her oversized sleeves, she procures another note with a similar -if not worse- handwriting that she received earlier that day. It is time for your assessment. > "Our guided speculation concludes that our other half has decided to cease with her inaction. Her mental processing capacity remains robust enough long-term planning, while the possibility of her turning maverick remains all time high. Further information is currently nil, however..." She points over to Mount Baratok in the distance, rather dramatically, to add. > "We summarise the mountain is where we ought to begin our investigation. Find her, deal with her before she beckons more harm to the realm."
ü§£ 1
Yuki Northernfur BOT 28-06-2024 13:46
Yuki listens intently as Yozuki talks about Asahi. Deal with her? Before she does more harm? There are a few pieces of the puzzle missing here, and it makes the shifter feel bad for having been absent for so long. He should have been closer. He vows to remedy the situation if he gets the chance. The mountain. Where they first met. How fitting. Back to the source, it seems. They would go and search, and they would find her, and then they.... Wait, they? Them? All of them?? "Woah woah, wait. We're all going? Him too?!" he exclaims, pointing at the kenku. He closes in on Yozuki and gently but firmly turns her around so their backs face the others. He whispers: "Are you sure bringing him along is a good idea?! He's nuts!" (edited)

Whizzerd BOT 28-06-2024 13:59
Whizzerd‚Äôs face remains neutral as Yozuki explains that she wants to deal Asahi. Why use the world deal though, that has many interpretations. Whizzerd was a little worried that they would have to kill Asahi, but perhaps there‚Äôs another way forward to resolve their conflict. ‚ÄúIf you don‚Äôt mind me asking, what harm has Asahi caused, has she been attacking people since you two have split?‚Äù As Yozuki been pulled aside, Whizzerd takes a second to look at the rest of their group. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs nice to meet the rest of you, I‚Äôm Whizzerd. My memories are still a little fuzzy so I‚Äôm sorry if we have met before.‚Äù As Whizzerd said his name, a plate crashed from another table, preventing Yuki from hearing his name. (edited)

Zee BOT 28-06-2024 14:57
Zee smiles and nods when Yozuki mentions his name, but does not interrupt. When the others start interrogating Yozuki, he listens intently
Yozuki BOT 28-06-2024 15:29
She tilts her head to the left and covers her mouth, just like one of those jade princesses in historical dramas responding courteously to an uncourteous conduct. If the reference is lost on you then you should go watch more asian period dramas. > "We wonder, was it too menacing a word to use in this situation? Standard procedure implies neutralisation of her physical functions resulting in ease of transport of her components. We'd suggest decapitation to preserve her cognitive circuits but we have learned -the hard way- that organics did not respond well to both the N-word and the D-word." After all, what is physical death but a long retirement for automatons such as her? Her own self can be made and remade from the sum of her parts and more. She herself has been decapitated twice by her own sister ever since coming to Barovia so she can be remade. But you organics wouldn't know, much less understand this, would you? > "As for your question, <another plate crashing noise>, we have received exactly zero reports of her activity. She took her utmost precaution to go undetected until today. Still, that does not mean her disappearance ought to be ignored, is it not?" Now to the other question. > "Nuts? Our diagnosis concludes that Redfeather is perfectly functional for this excursion. Besides, there is a lot more experiments to run. Oh, what fun!" Any other questions? Let's see if we can prolong this enough until the Martikovs are out of plate and money for their business. Ceramic production is rather expensive in this era, you know.

Yuki Northernfur BOT 29-06-2024 01:27
Yuki listens to Yozuki. He bites his lips, deep in thoughts. ‚ÄúFunctional‚Äù. Well‚Ä¶ sure, he‚Äôs ‚Äúfunctional‚Äù. A vial of acid can be functional as well, it doesn‚Äôt mean you should have one in your back pocket. He sighs. Again, no point in asking questions, her wires came to the conclusion that the bird was logically important to the plan. He‚Äôll have to make do and keep an eye on the kenku so that he doesn‚Äôt sow chaos everywhere. He turns back with Yozuki to address the others. ‚ÄúAlright guys, well you heard her. We are to find Asahi, approach her, evaluate our best course of action, and sensibly act upon it,‚Äù he says, essentially rephrasing everything Yozuki said. He tilts his head towards her to whisper in a voice that can be heard by the others in their group but not beyond to the patrons. ‚ÄúAlso, don‚Äôt use that N-word. Some people are sensitive to it. The best we can do in her case is fragmentize. But we should avoid that as well if possible.‚Äù He talks loudly to everyone again. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm glad to see we already all know each other by name,‚Äù he glances at Whizzerd but the half-orc nods with a confident look on his face, so Yuki has no choice but to continue, ‚Äúso it should make things easy. Do you have some sort of beacon that points in her general direction? Or are we just going to the last place you saw her?‚Äù he asks Yozuki.

But that still leaves two of you."

Yuki Northernfur BOT 29-06-2024 04:52
"I do have a thermal thingy," Yuki says, pulling something out from his bag. The area around the group suddenly becomes as hot and dry as a desert on a fine day, around 35 degrees Celsius. "This can keep everyone around me warm, but it means you have to stay in my vicinity. It could be useful in a bind, but a leash otherwise, so you might want to have your own warming method." "I also don't have any means of faster transport than my own two feet. Sorry about that."

Yozuki BOT 29-06-2024 10:34
‚ÄúAh, you wish to talk about our origin and directive while we are present?‚Äù Why not, they‚Äôre here to risk their life for her sake anyway. Ask away. > ‚ÄúAllow us to answer your question with another. How does one know how to breathe, eat, and sleep?‚Äù She traces her metallic fingers to Redfeather‚Äôs sleep deprived eyes. Not good. If the bird must die, it should not be from something so mundane as overwork. > ‚ÄúWe surmise it is similar in that aspect to organics. We were designed with a purpose, a nature, if you will. For us to act against our directive is akin to you not breathing and sleeping as long as we intend to do so.‚Äù Does it make sense? > ‚ÄúWe have more than one directive, but the primary has always been to explore across as many different worlds we are ableto and transmit our recordings back to our homeworld. Our other half has veered from her nature, it is our duty to‚Ä¶ deal with her.‚Äù It‚Äôs too bad she has not synthesised any chloroform for use today, otherwise she‚Äôd have used it on the bird to force him to sleep.

Yuki Northernfur BOT 29-06-2024 15:28
‚ÄúAlright, so we got Feathers saying he got a ride of some sort. Then we got Zee‚Äôs Pegasus for himself plus one. Let say me for the kick of it, even though he was clearly set for the bird..... I‚Äôm not judging by the way, but I‚Äôm keeping an eye on you. It‚Äôs for the best. Still, that‚Äôs three. Then we have our half-orc friend, who is on foot, and Yozuki who has gracefully given us the opportunity to ride in her chariot.‚Äù The latest remark is meant to strike home. ‚ÄúTo make sure we do not stray, and to make sure our host can guide us to a location they are most likely to get a hint on, I would vote for the chariot. As in, we all just ride that to our destination. If any of you would like to give another opinion, please make yourself heard. If not...‚Äù he points to the chariot outside, ‚Äúthen I assume we‚Äôll be riding in this bad boy.‚Äù
Whizzerd BOT 30-06-2024 00:19

Brocc[Redfeather10/Chronn6] -8 30-06-2024 02:57
"Sound good! Yes-" Redfeather strokes his beak thoughtfully as he stares up towards their primary destination. "How fast I make it? From here to peak? Run all the way to the top and THROW SELF ONTO ROCKS AT BOTTOM! Hahahahaaa!" He shakes his head with amusement, imagining his broken body painting that grey stone. He sighs- longingly- "Have to fight. Bugs live up there. Giant worms and shamans. Think able at least summon storms but not have chance kill before~" The kenku sputters to a stop as yozuki just- touches his face. He's so shocked he doesn't even flinch, only blinking up at her confused. Beneath his feathers he begins to sweat nervously at the physical contact. How foolish! She's already been elbows deep inside his chest cavity! "Rawk...hem... I- point was-" Redfeather looks back to his book of diagrams, shrinking in on himself a tad. He desperately scrabbles to bring back his train of thought and at least seem somewhat comprehensible today. "I executed. That how end up here. Been talking others- seem about 50/50. Talk about separation from asashi few times. Sound violent, even if I not understand exactly how work." "Thinking... Thinking it hard manufacture something sentient enough touch weave. Reality warped by perception of all things- it take strong enough mind! So what solution? Artificial soul? Strong enough mechanism? Surrogate mind extracted and rendered workable state by... Sensory deprivation..." Again the diminutive bird shrugs off the memories threatening to pluck him straight from lucidity. "Aaah! It not important! Just mean not think that your purpose. Or- more like- why creator be honest? If capable of total planar assimilation and matter synthesis more then able implant any memory, any program, any falsehood want." "You equipped with suite of advanced weapons, capability fabricate any infrastructure required, and other-"

Yuki Northernfur BOT 04-07-2024 02:03
As they walk, Yuki is fumbling through his bag. He's not looking for something in particular, but rather anything that could be useful during this trip. So he waits, a smirk on his face. It usually takes less that half a minute for it to begin revealing its wisdom. What truth is it going to tell him today? (edited)

I'll have to test it out when I'm out of here." "So, long story short, this little bad boy tells horrible truths and facts. It's quite interesting." DM [Ricochet] BOT 05-07-2024 23:56
The ass analysis makes for the perfect distraction as the group climbs the mountain to the scene of the bloody pitched battle between the two construct twins. Looking at the place now, with great, rocky cliffs rising sharp on one side and ancient pine trees laden with snow on the other, the scene seems unusually silent. Whizzerd BOT 06-07-2024 01:00

Yuki Northernfur BOT 06-07-2024 12:44
Yuki is brought back from his reverie by the surrounding air becoming cold enough to be noticeable. Right, they were headed to the mountains after all. But as he looks into his Bag of Holding for his Thermal Cube, his hand touches something soft. The coat! He had found it on Mt. Ghakis during a reconnaissance mission. Half-buried in the snow and surrounded by the cold, still air of a cavern, it had been preserved in pristine condition. Long and white, with a hood lined with the thick white fur of a northern yak, the design looked remarkably similar to the coat the Astral Guards of his hometown wore. Where he would usually leave such artifact behind, the resemblance was so pronounced that he could not bring himself to. He picked it up. The textile had been stiff for years, the fur cracking under his touch. But he brought it back with him, and tended to it so it would regain its long lost luster. It‚Äôs golden seams and borders gave it a rich look, and after weeks of care, it was not only usable, but looked almost new. However, Yuki wasn‚Äôt going to stop there. He wanted it to be as close as possible to the Astral Guards‚Äô. So he added scarf-like over-sleeves; drapes of sorts covering the arms. In a gradient from dark purple to dark blue, constellations of yellow thread would adorn the fabric, with a golden rim to match the rest of the coat. Straps would allow the wearer to close it up for further protection against the wind. .
‚≠ê 1
Yuki Northernfur BOT 06-07-2024 12:45
The Astral Guards, otherwise known as the Soldiers of the Stars, Guardians of the Astral Realm, and a few more denominations throughout history, were people who devoted their lives to Astral Wandering and its layout, realms, and denizens. They were the rescue team. It is quite possible to get either stuck or lost while Astral Wandering, or fall into a mindset that makes one want to stay there forever. These Guards existed to go fetch you and bring you out, sometimes having to either convince you, by logic or by force, or by fighting whatever is keeping you there. They were heroes in Yuki‚Äôs village, and it was a great honor and heavy duty to be part of them. And so, it brings great pride to Yuki to have created what one would consider an homage to their colors, and donning it makes the shifter stand straight, his chin high, and mentally ready to challenge the world. As he puts it on, he keeps an interested ear out for any detail Yozuki would share about what happened with his sister.
‚≠ê 1
Yozuki BOT 06-07-2024 18:28

Our role had come to a natural end the moment she had made a number of reliable allies.‚Äù Then she moves on to a piece of rock bearing scorch marks too artificial to be natural. Brocc[Redfeather10/Chronn6] -8 07-07-2024 05:50
As they've climbed in altitude and the temperature has begun to drop redfeather remains just as energetic. As the cold wind bites at his cheeks and settles in his bones the blissful numbness feels... A misty breath escapes his beak. It's better then the languid suffering he's been forced to endure these past days- the WEAKNESS!! "AAARGH! WALK ENTIRE FUCKING WAY! NOT SINGLE FIGHT! NOT BIRD OR WOLF OR DRAGON OR...Hrrk..." The kenku Shouts Angrily, bouncing up and down in place. Before he can spin himself up into a longer rant he's cut off by a coughing fit. Doubling over his little body is wracked by spasms before he promptly vomits noxious bile over a nearby stone. "Urgh... It wierd. Something wrong. Not go 10 feet here without get jumped." Wiping his beak redfeather produces a large parchment and stretches it across the tree. He sketches out the claw patterns in a messy scrawl before leaning in to inspect them more closely. Gently as if handling a raw wound he picks flecks out of the wood grain to analyze later. This specific design remains beyond him- her claws are incredibly dangerous it doesn't take a genius to figure that. However exact mechanisms? If it were as simple as them being normally forged blades Enhanced with magic the evidence would be plain. The usual thin magic field would've prevented the actual material from making contact with their target- beyond that the wood grain is entirely without the evidence of warping in contact. This suggests some other energy implementation... "Hmm. Seeing seeing..." The kenku squats like a malformed gargoyle or carrion beast on the stone. Hmm! Mostly granite with a high quartz content- intriguingly it has only partially melted instead of being blown to bits. Redfeather opens his book to a page with a recreation of the Yozuki's arm cannon and scribbles crystallization temperatures. It would normally be safe to assume the usual method that mages use to get such effects would be used... (edited)
Brocc[Redfeather10/Chronn6] -8 07-07-2024 06:20
But specifically the concave lense and beam of light confuses the situation. Usually by filling in one of three requirements with one's magic explosions of suitable size could be created- However to magically substitute for both the fuel and heat required to instantly subsume all the oxygen in the effect radius would be... Inefficient in the extreme. Perhaps some sort of particle accelerator? Or direct conversion of matter into energy? At this range the instantaneous heat index would have to be well within the spectrum to instantly vaporize steel. "Carry 150... multiplied by... Sum total 2,500 degrees. But if that right it not form pattern like this. Ugh! Stupid bird!" Angry that once again he can't absorb simple elemental mechanics he snaps his book shut and turns to stomp away. But something far more interesting catches his attention. He leaps into the flower patch "UM! WHAT FUCK?! You say smashed! This look like beheading! Skim details to not make me worry?!" He's seen every kind of execution, act of violence, and terrible deed a humanoid can commit against fellow man. Even if she doesn't have a jugular or other familiar circulatory features unless she could literally synthesize a bottomless supply within herself there'd be little other explanation! "Bah!" Scowls the kenku, even as he dips some PH testing strips in a still vaugely liquid patch. The resulting nonsesnical data only serves to intrigue him more. Chemicals and industrial substances are another unfortunate topic he has a great deal of expertise with. He scoops up a few vials and stows them in a safe pocket for later inspection. Noticing a drop left on a claw he swabs it across his tongue. Familiar chemical burn sensation but it's clearly neither basic or acidic in a way to explain simply the properties. "Hmm... Glycol additive without water base... forcibly stabilized flourocarbon? But she not traditional electronic so not make sense... Need test need test"
‚≠ê 3

Brocc[Redfeather10/Chronn6] -8 07-07-2024 06:37

Yozuki BOT 07-07-2024 09:03
Impressive. She stares, unflinchingly at the kenku getting busy with his attempt at science. He said he had been learning himself, but to this extend? Not without rigorous time spent collecting the proper knowledge along with the trial an error. One can take the kenku out of the laboratory, but one can never take the laboratory out of the kenku. Out of respect she would sit down next to him and shows how their armaments work, this time with her mantis blades, which begins to vibrate. > ‚ÄúMonomolecular blades. A blade one molecule in width, forged from a supercondensed carbon alloy with ultra microscopic precision tempering to its buckytube formation. Apply vibrations to the blade to maximise its cutting power. The result is a blade that would cut everything on a molecular level.‚Äù And she noticed his struggle at deciphering the manner of weapon employed to the rock, which she would readily elaborate. > ‚ÄúLight particle condensation, utilising their own photon energy emission to propel them forward. Repeat the process hundreds, thousands, millions of times within the span of few seconds. The result is what we dub as Light Amplification by Stimulated Emission of Radiation.*‚Äù Such a lengthy explanation for what a kenku can imitate with the magic that flows within his veins. She avoids making a comment on the beheading part, mentioning the D-word is a no no, after all. Also the last part about her makers. It wouldn‚Äôt be the first time someone has questioned their methods, but the automaton wasn‚Äôt made to enforce their ways. What bugs her is the other point Redfeather mentioned. The mountain is supposed to be perilous, but everything has been quiet so far. No wildlife to ambush them, no critters to be spotted. Nothing. This may be a sign in itself.
Yuki Northernfur BOT 07-07-2024 13:38
Yuki listens to the conversations around him with attention, but all the technical talk about science and mechanisms fly right over his head. He‚Äôs not really into understanding how the twins work inside, or the details of their weapons. He‚Äôs much more interested in how they think, why they think that way, and who they are as entities. As he walks around, taking in the scenery and trying to find some hints as to where the other half has gone, the group members looking in his direction would see a white bow snapped on his back. The most perceptive would notice that it is missing the bowstring. In other words, that bow looks as useful as a sword without the blade. At his belt are four curious contraptions, mismatching each other; a sort of golden censer to burn incense, a crudely made bowl of clay that looked painted by a child, a dark and burnt metal brazier that could only be used to make tiny fires, and a rock. Yes, just a rock. Tied to a piece of rope. He is looking at the sky, thinking about all he has heard, when he decides to interrupt the construct and the avian talking about blades and guns. ‚ÄúConsidering Asahi can most likely do the things that you do, I‚Äôll make sure to remember she can ‚Äòapply vibrations to maximize results on a molecular level‚Äô, and ‚Äòrepeat the process hundreds, thousands, millions of times‚Äô,‚Äù he says, really just picking what he wants from the conversation. .
Yuki Northernfur BOT 07-07-2024 13:38
‚ÄúBut the part about ‚Äòreeducation‚Äô doesn‚Äôt sit right with me. Someone that thinks differently from what others expect them to is not necessarily wrong.‚Äù He closes the distance between them so he can talk to Yo while looking at her. He speaks loud enough to everyone knows where he stands. ‚ÄúYou have told me countless times that you two are robots programmed to achieve a mission. A mission to record findings about the worlds and the realms, through exploration, and then transmit those to whomever sent you. I understand that much.‚Äù ‚ÄúI also understand through interaction with you and Asa that to complete that objective, you were given the ability to take various inputs, analyze them, and form your own conclusions about them; what they mean, if they are threats or not, and how to deal with those conclusions, either for specific situations or similar ones arising in the future. Where I‚Äôm from, that‚Äôs called ‚Äòlearning‚Äô.‚Äù He crouches down to her, the numerous things on his belt making various tocks and tings as they softly hit each other, like a chime made of a child‚Äôs treasures. ‚ÄúEven though you were one in the past, there has been a time where you were two. And from that point on, you two have learned from different sources, through your respective experiences. You cannot dismiss the possibility that the change in her behavior, her deviation from what you think is her correct path, is due to something that she learned and you haven‚Äôt yet.‚Äù ‚ÄúShe might be on to something. Her new journey may be even more important to your homeland than yours in the end. Or not. We won‚Äôt know. I won‚Äôt be able to live long enough to see the results. But one thing I know, is that her new path wouldn‚Äôt be more unworthy than any other.‚Äù

Zee BOT 07-07-2024 14:21
*The Kobold only half listens to the rest of the group. He is fairly certain he was not hired to provide his input into the machinations of machines. Not that he would be of much help. Apparently, even the warforged don't understand the strength of community and oneness. They were literally a single entity and still went to war with itself. Zee briefly recalls the strength of being part of a pack. It was nearly impossible to know where one claw ended and another began. He quickly pushes the thought from his mind -- it is too painful. The clan's slaughter destroyed a large part of him leaving only the shell that exists now. He is fairly certain that his job here is to provide a strong tooth, claw, and tail. Zee continues to patrol the perimeter while keeping in mental contact with his owl that monitors the area from above*

Yozuki BOT 07-07-2024 22:10
"She learned..." It's true. It's not a ground breaking statement to her since her model is meant to be able to learn and adapt. She shakes her head and tries to find a compromise in this dilemma. ‚≠ê 2
DM [Ricochet] BOT 08-07-2024 07:26
Once the group begins paying more attention to their surroundings again, several of them notice peculiarities. Zee notices first that the trail Whizzerd pointed out earlier was well-worn despite the not infrequent snowfall of the area. At first it appears to be a single trail, but on closer inspection, it is a single trail of the same footfalls in the same footprints repeated over and over. Someone has been methodically visiting this site along the exact same path, then returning from whence they came. Yozuki‚Äôs completes her scans, cross-referencing them against her visual files on the fateful encounter, and comes to the conclusion that every spare scrap of metal, circuitry, and wiring that littered the place has been retrieved, no matter how small. Finally, Yuki feels the hairs on the back of his neck prickle despite the luxurious coat. Gazing into the distance up the mountain, he sees a lone figure standing on a cliff overlooking a narrow passage. It‚Äôs almost impossible to see ‚Äî just a silhouette at this range ‚Äî and completely motionless except for the fabric of clothing fluttering in the wind.
Brocc[Redfeather10/Chronn6] -8 08-07-2024 11:26

Then why not use that fucking thing for the reason you made it coward!" The kenku growls and thumbs a switch. The central pair of clockwork cylinders segment and slide into one another- reducing the primary firing chamber from a diameter suitable for shot munitions. Capacity matters little when using a holding enchantment but in this specific instance he's not had time to make one for this particular type. One by one he loads five Sabot rounds into it. When his claws touch them a particular whine sparks up as they start to vibrate, the exotic alloy entering a particularly energetic state. He pauses at the last one- inspecting it's diamond tip for flaws. Finding none he clicks the chamber back into place. "I be one do it." Yozuki BOT 11-07-2024 16:52
The moment Asahi started glitching about, Yozuki had already transfigured her extended arm to her own laser gun. All this out of place assessment holds no meaning if she could just put Asahi out of her misery. A single beam of her supercharged laser was all it took to finish the job, leaving the scraps that used to be her sister in cinders. Farewell to her old self. Farewell to any obstructions that distracts her from completing her directive. Except that her arm was actually frozen in place, still extended not unlike a performer's hand longing for its better half to dance like the old days. For a reason yet to be understood, she lowers her hand instead as a dark teardrop falls on her left cheek. A glitch? Or was it a lingering memory of their time together? Had she too, learned something that alters her judgments so? > "...Indeed. We shall be whole again, together across the stars. For üé∂ Impossible things are happening every day! üé∂" T'was indeed part of one of the many songs they learned in a faraway world. All the monotonous intonation in her usual voice, gone. A far cry from the most beautiful songs humanity could possibly sing, but the best her kind can ever offer. <Performance 19> Without breaking her song she gives nod to all of her companions one by one as she marches forward. The roar of the winds make way for her answer to this challenge. > "Very well. Let us begin the finale of this performance." AS4H1-Y02Q shall dance, one last time.

Yuki Northernfur BOT 12-07-2024 02:56

By my side.‚Äù He instinctively takes one step closer to Asahi. But one is all it takes. The realization of what he‚Äôs thinking comes to him like a backpack full of bricks was just put on his shoulders. The heaviness is staggering. What is he doing? What‚Äôs his plan? What is he trying to achieve here? Is he going to throw everything out the window for the possibility to be reunited with a possibly very broken automaton? The lives of the people here, the safety of everyone else? She‚Äôs her, but is she? He realizes that being away from her for so long means he has no clue as to what happened to her, what changed, what she is now. Is she really the same Asahi he met? The one that popped into his mind throughout his time here? The thing with this realm is that no one ever gets out. And although he believes that there is a way, he is relatively certain that no one has found it yet. And since he has always been leaning towards ‚ÄòAsahi invincible‚Äô rather than ‚ÄòAsahi needs support‚Äô, he took it for granted that he could just waltz in at any time to pick up where they had left. .

Zee BOT 12-07-2024 14:46
*The Kobold watches the scene unfold. This is his first job in Barovia where he doesn't feel connected to the group. The emotions are just too disparate. There is no consistency or consensus. He clocks anger and insanity, regret and resolve. And singing. What is that about? Usually, when he ventures forth with a group of adventureres, they become his temporary pack. He watches their movements and subtly incorporates them in his own technique. It is the same strategy wolves and raptors use. Zee casually wonders if this group shares enough of the same goals to let him use the technique, or if it will be utter chaos. Worst case scenario, there is always his owl. His telepathic link ensures they are always going in the same direction. Together, they scan the perimeter, looking for hidden hazards.*

He can't register the taste in his beak over an all consuming mental static buzzing in his skull. The broken ribs don't register either. Yuki Northernfur BOT 21-07-2024 03:52

On top of that, a vibration in the ground raises an alarm in his head. He was born and grew on snowy mountain peaks. He knows this vibration, this sound. An avalanche is coming. Fast. Getting buried alive isn't on his to-do list for today, so he decides to take care of that first. He had just dodged the robot's wires and would be in a pickle if he got caught again. He has to put as much distance between him and the robots as possible, while getting off the ground as well. While he runs away from the enemies, his earth elemental is slowly moving towards them. Hard On looks a bit limp now, like it's empty of all its juice. "You did well," *Yuki thinks as he stops concentrating on it. The rock elemental, mid-step, crumbles into a pile of rocks while Yuki takes his censer and utters the magic incantation: "Suck and blow, fast and slow, Forth and back, then attack. BLOW JOB, I CHOOSE YOU!" An Air Elemental springs to life. Without a word, it knows what to do. It scoops up Yuki and starts flying towards the sky in search of higher grounds. (edited)
DM [Esh] BOT 22-07-2024 04:04
A mighty crack can be heard overhead as more and more of the snowcapped mountain falls down below where you all are standing. Due to both the incoming avalanche and the intensifying weather, the thickness of the snow is ever increasing around, making it difficult to make out what's too far ahead of you- or above you, but despite the imminent disaster you still hear the chomping of the dragon golem and the zapping arcs of the electrified chassis of the scrap bot nearby. The winds are picking up speed as well, with the avalanche snow raining down from above, staying in the air is becoming a hazard of its own.

Yuki Northernfur BOT 25-07-2024 09:58

Yuki Northernfur BOT 25-07-2024 09:59
From the outside, it seems like a humanoid arctic fox is skating on the ground at incredible speed. He's leaving snowflakes in his wake that look a lot brighter and whiter than their natural counterparts, his fluffy white tail almost straight behind him from the speed. Soon, he starts actually running himself, making a beeline for the crack he infiltrated earlier. Boulders of snow and rock are falling from the sky, crashing left, right and center. A quick glance to the left shows the dragon being engulfed by the snow. He weaves, jumps, slides, and makes other movements that would drop the jaw of most aerobic professionals. He is on survival autopilot. And he is able to dodge everything. As soon as he gets to the slit, he slide-breaks and immediately starts climbing its side all the way up its 40 feet height. It's not the first time he's done so, mind you, having been born and raised in snowy peaks, but it's probably the first time he's done it so fast. At the top, he falls on his back, panting, looking at the blizzard developing around him. Catching his breath, he kinda forgot about his Blow Job immobile at the bottom of the valley, waiting for a command... How can he forget about such a nice and dedicated Blow Job!?!

Rapidly he begins to dig deeper and deeper in, allowing the pack to set again after every few feet. With the size of the party he labors heavily to carve out enough space in the primary internal chamber. Once reaching close enough to the leeward side of the large mound he retreats back out to start collecting the now solidified blocks he'd pulled from his entry way. These he uses to shore up the walls of the internal cave on each side- then carefully seals up the hole already being snowed shut. Cutting them to the right shape he thickens the back wall with a sturdy arch to prevent collapse- then carefully cuts back out a thin switchback entryway the others will have to squeeze through. Caked in ice and snow the kenku carefully allows a thin beam of plasma to shoot up through the highest point of the roof, so that they don't find themselves suffocating and the heat can escape enough to ensure no melting will jeopardize its structural integrity. "Rawk! Finally- this do..." Shimmying back out he hops up and raises his claws, precipitating a ball of white hot plasma so bright it almost seems enough to drive away the storm "ALL INSIDE OVER HERE! OUT OF WEATHER!" (edited)

Yozuki BOT 30-07-2024 22:33
For what it's worth, the time alone under the ice gave the machine a time to reflect. About death, the finality of life. A concept that never had a meaning for her kind. They would simply cease to function, and another would take their place. Simple. Fail at their purpose, and they would be retired, scrapped for future iteration. Succeed, and they would be scrapped as an example for future models. Veer from their directive, and they would be labelled as a maverick for retirement. Finish it, and they would serve no other purpose, only waiting for retirement. The lifecycle of a product is circle of death, Asahi has learned that all along, and such was the fate Yozuki was to force on her. > ... And it was then the veil of snow and ice was lifted from her. Yozuki returns to the waking world, systems still recovering under the freezing temperature.

Yozuki BOT 31-07-2024 13:28
If you work as a physician and saw your patient doing all this self-recovering routine like the bloody bird just did, turn around and run far away. Yuki Northernfur BOT 31-07-2024 13:36
After Redfeather yelled at him to watch Yozuki, Yuki stayed nearby, though she didn't seem to need watching. His mind got lost into thinking until the bird came back to shove them all inside this makeshift cave with snow walls, inside which Yozuki now pops a tent out of nowhere. Redfeather is pacing along the edge, muttering something to himself. The problem with that bird is that he could be going completely coo-coo and no one would notice the difference. Yuki, sitting in a corner of the tent in a fetal position, not from trauma but from lack of space, is looking into space. His eyes are seeing nothing, lost in a void somewhere. But he breaks the silence nonetheless. "Well that didn't go as I had hoped..." he says to no one in particular. "Maybe as some had expected, but not as I had hoped." His head doesn't move but his eyes turn to focus on Yozuki when she mentions her birthday. It registers funny in his mind, like something that he isn't sure if he wants to put in his memory bank or not. He decides to put it on the back burner for now. "What's your assessment of what's going on and how far gone is your sister, Yo?"
Yozuki BOT 31-07-2024 13:48
Meanwhile she moves closer to the heater in the center of the room, perhaps intending to dry her clothes. A strategic decision, or she's being self conscious with wet and dampened clothes, one can never tell. Her head finally twitched with this new nickname, Yo? > "She, Asahi, had perhaps abandoned all hope of her own survival. She is aware that her time is limited... and this is what she chose to do with what remaining time she has while her cognition still functions." > "...a legacy, her legacy, that there once existed a unit, not simply AS4H1-Y02Q, but something more." She keeps staring into the heater, the light of the fire dancing in her round, obsidian eyes. > "Yuki Northernfur, we... I must apologise, had I started looking for her sooner, we might have more options on our hands."
Yuki Northernfur BOT 31-07-2024 13:58
Yuki listens to her answers, staring at the floor, and stays quiet for a few seconds before answering: "No one can predict the future. Extrapolation can only go so far, even for machines. I don't blame you. But I don't think we're out of options yet. I don't think we even know what our options are, and we'd have to risk some things in order to see the extent of what works. Things like our physical or mental well-being, for example." He raises his stare on the others. "But I feel like you don't want to do that. You already have your sights on terminating her. I know he does," he adds, quickly lifting his arm towards Redfeather and lowering it back to his side. "And you don't seem very eager to brainwash on solutions beyond... what did you call it? Neutralisation? Have you given up all together? This is it? Mission to kill, no alternatives?" His voice is not loud, but agitated. Like someone looking for someone else who has been lost in the woods for too long and others are just throwing the towel.
üò≠ 1
Yozuki BOT 31-07-2024 14:09
Towards this question, she only responded shortly. > "Would you choose to honor her memory, Yuki Northernfur? Or would you prolong her suffering?" She would stay silent after, who knew robots have a thing for rethorics and dramatisation? > "In theory, as long as our personality core survives, we can always be reconstructed. As I have experienced, multiple times." Now she chooses to stare and meet your eyes. > "But we have seen that it has deteriorated, thus, our logical suggestion to neutralise her as our first step. Of course, one may choose to believe in the statistically unlikely."
Yuki Northernfur BOT 31-07-2024 14:13
"Are you saying that her deterioration is 100% irreversible? Because I know that blowing her into pieces is most likely 100% irreversible." They stare at each other for what would seem forever from an onlooker's perspective. "Where is that personality core?" (edited)
Yozuki BOT 31-07-2024 14:18
She slowly begins to undress in that frigid weather. A button press on her nape exposes her torso open. There, her equivalent of a beating heart. Her aether engine, located safely besides a small, but securely encased black box. > "Unless she has tampered with her own design, which we are aware that she has. This would be its original location."
Yozuki BOT 31-07-2024 14:20
"Fixing hardware is trivial, Yuki Northernfur. But consider this while you're at it: even if we manage to reconstruct her personality to where it was, would you still be able to call her the Asahi you once knew?"
 (edited)
Yuki Northernfur BOT 31-07-2024 14:29
Yuki scoffs. "A fresh start is better than an eternal end. Few are those who would say otherwise." "But that's my last resort. I believe she's still in there. And a few modifications can fix it. Of course that comes from someone born and raised in a backward village of an unknown mountain peak, away from any sort of technological advances." "However, she has never shown hostility towards me. You may not have noticed, but she has not raised her weapons towards me. Not a single time." "Sure, there was the big avalanche incident, but maybe she knew I was going to get out of it with flying colors. Choosing an area for our show down that is so advantageous for me. Telling me we could be back together to look into the future. There is hope." He seems to be grabbing at straws at times in his arguments, and his tone betrays that when he speaks, like he's trying to convince himself. His eyes darken as he looks back at Yozuki. "I just wish you would see it as well. Maybe I'll have to make you."

Yozuki BOT 31-07-2024 14:41
She tilts her head, seemingly befuddled by this display, might this be a threat sleeved under a veil of optimism? > "Very well, Yuki Northernfur. Though I do not understand it, I owe you the opportunity to see this through your way. But if the moment ever comes she puts her crosshairs to your direction, run." Then she goes back to her seat, finally putting her engine back under her diamond skin protection. Another of her black tear drop falls, once again. > "I wish I did understand it better."

Yuki Northernfur BOT 31-07-2024 14:52
Yuki falls silent. Did he go too far? What did he really mean when he said all that? As the wind blows noisily outside and the snow walls built by Redfeather slowly erode away around the tent, his thoughts take over once more. What's his plan? Who are his allies? Who can he trust to have his back? What are his options? What can he do? What if the little black box is already done for? What if she can't be repaired? What's his plan? What's his plan?
Whizzerd BOT 31-07-2024 16:13
Whizzerd stays a way from the others as he tries to take grasp of his fleeting mind. As the wounds he carries start to heal he breaths a sigh of relief as he manages to keep hold of the clarity he had gained. Whizzerd joins up with the others, listening in on Yuki and Yozuki‚Äôs conversation. ‚ÄúCould you collect the personality core if I restrain her?‚Äù he asks Yozuki, ‚ÄúIt may be hard since she can fly, but if we can ground her, it‚Äôs possible we can extract the core.‚Äù Whizzerd gives Yuki a reassuring glance. Making it known to him he stands with trying to end this without destroying Asahi.
Yozuki BOT 31-07-2024 17:37
She does not immediately answer, perhaps calculating the chances of success with an invisible equation in her head. > "Assuming we have the means to ground her, that option is not completely impossible." But to tell the truth, even she is not that sure. Then she finally turns her head, scanning Whizzerd top to bottom now that he just healed. Her eyes taking note of the visible effects those scars and crystal growth might have on his mental state. > "She will struggle, and you will more than bleed, do you have the resolve to see it through, Whizzerd?" (edited)
Whizzerd BOT 31-07-2024 17:54
Yozuki‚Äôs words give Whizzerd pause. Even he knows that the more he bleeds, the more likely he will lose himself completely. However looking at the warmth that now inhabits Yozuki, his hesitation diminishes. ‚ÄúI gave you both my word that I would see this through with you. I don‚Äôt intend to go back on it.‚Äù A memory stirs within the half-orc. A warmer time in a far off land. As he reminisce on his past, the crystals on his body shrink ever so slightly. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve gotten through worse before, and I‚Äôve got people here who remember me for who I am. What ever happens now, I know I won‚Äôt have to do it alone.‚Äù

Yozuki BOT 31-07-2024 19:21

Whizzerd BOT 31-07-2024 20:11

Yuki Northernfur BOT 01-08-2024 01:04
Yuki seems to come back from a long trip in his own mind. He could hear the voices but wasn't listening. He snaps out of it and sees that the half-orc is talking with Yozuki. "Seems a better time than any to get going, is everyone prepared?" the large companion asks. 'Damn it!' Yuki thinks. This had been the perfect opportunity to hear the half-orc's name since Yozuki always calls people by their full name every three or four sentences. But of course, he had to zone out during that conversation. Tsk! "Yeah," he answers as he stands up from his corner. "I guess we should be going soon." As if to drive the point home, part of the snow wall on the outside crumbles down right next to the tent, small pieces tumbling on the tight tarp roof, making ominous dull sounds. The wind is relentless and is starting to loosen the structure, the clicking of metal and flapping of ropes louder by the minute. "...how about now? Yeah, let's go now," he says, gathering his things and exiting the tent into the blizzard.

Yuki Northernfur BOT 01-08-2024 15:08

Yozuki BOT 01-08-2024 22:42
Yozuki wanted to answer with a nod to Redfeather's remark. With how much effort would it take to restore a personality core as delicate as Asahi's. Just imagine, the subject in question has 215 years worth of records and learnings one would have to piece one by one, like an ocean of jigsaw puzzles. Then she refrains, what strategic benefit is there for snuffing out hope? But there is perhaps another reason: one born from her time studying all these imperfect organics pulling through even when the chances of success are about nil. Who knows? Perhaps they are really favored by the statistically unlikely. She takes a long look at the scarred avian and reflects back on the actual reason she wanted him on this expedition. Yes, the team needed someone to take the full brunt of Asahi's traps and machinations while the rest would work to counteract them, preferably someone mad with very little attachment to life. And the plan worked out a little too well, the bird is even volunteering for it. She should be proud, but instead, she would come over to Redfeather's direction and slip him two vials of red from her belt. <2x Potion of Healing> > "Exercise caution. There are no more clones to support you this time. My work on your physique is far from over, Redfeather." (edited)

Brocc[Redfeather10/Chronn6] -8 04-08-2024 00:45
Redfeather glares down at the machine below, waving a fist Angrily. What's the point of checking all these footholds if she's not going to use them?? While the bird never had any illusions about the state of his friend, or her ability to rip him limb from limb, he's beginning to question weather or not she can be left alone for more then 5 minutes without something going horribly wrong. But at the very least she pretends to care... Nobody else takes the time to do that. The kenku growls to himself and decides to start double checking instead. He pauses on an outcropping to inspect it thoroughly- claws tracing the fault lines in the stone. The material should be strong enough to hold. Might even make some nice building blocks. He moves on- claws biting into the ice as he swings over a gap to eye a precarious boulder up the slope from yuki. Redfeather sets himself as a wedge between it and the ground, settling in to wait for yuki to pass so it doesn't crush him. "...Always follow with back swing... that opening? He babbles on to himself, focusing on something to keep him present and turned fully away from the dark shadows whispering at the back of his mind. Dispite his... state during the fight every moment of violence between him and ashashi repeats over and over running circles through his mind. He balls his hands into fists to keep them from shaking, trying and failing to calm himself. It replays repeatedly, it's as if the sword is still buried in his chest- humming that frequency as it liquefies his soft tissues and pain crashes outward through his system.

Small rocks begin falling past their heads, then larger ones as the earth seems to try to throw them off the cliff!
DM [Ricochet] BOT 04-08-2024 08:25

Brocc[Redfeather10/Chronn6] -8 06-08-2024 02:55

DM [Esh] BOT 06-08-2024 04:57

Yozuki BOT 06-08-2024 14:41
So high, so skyscrapingly high as if they're trying to orbit off the atmosphere. Climbing the peak of Mount Baratok was supposed to be a task Yozuki would do after dealing with her twin. The thought to complete her original directive to transmit a signal back to her homeworld from the peak of Baratok comes to mind. Alas, such a massive transdimensional transmission would only attract absolute peril, one that the party may not be well prepared for. Back to the present, the only way forward is to climb onwards and upwards. Yozuki carefully grips the cliffsides which was previously used by the nimbler ones in the party. DM [Esh] BOT 06-08-2024 17:14

DM [Esh] BOT 06-08-2024 17:18

DM [Esh] BOT 07-08-2024 05:18
Before Redfeather has a chance to descend he hears an unsettling giggling from beneath him followed by an explosion of ice erupts around him!! # PWWWM Ice bursts out, showering the kenku in razor sharp ice shards. An Ice mephit explodes on contact, giggling as it showers its victims in jagged ice before it wisps away! The wind picks up shortly after catching Redfeather and Yuki in their surprise, pulling them off the mountain.
Yuki Northernfur BOT 07-08-2024 14:57
Yuki hears Yozuki call at Redfeather to use a piton and drop them a rope, but the way the kenku reacts tells him one of the following scenarios is unfolding: a) he cannot for some reason, such as the rock not being normal or lacking the required items, b) he is purposefully ignoring her for some reason, such as Redfeather being Redfeather, or c) he is busy with something else for some reason, such as getting himself killed. Due to the lack of enemy and the fact that Yozuki said ‚Äúplease‚Äù, which is Redfeather‚Äôs weak point, this would rule out B and C, and leave A. And considering that Redfeather doesn‚Äôt need pitons nor ropes to get on, off, or even through a vertical surface, it would be logical to assume he simply doesn‚Äôt have the stuff. The other four members would benefit from that rope, no doubt. The half-orc was last seen rolling down the slope, his crystals sparkling like a disco ball, and even himself was just yanked off his feet by some flying ice goblin or whatnot. If everyone was tethered to the robotic 200lb ass walking next to them, they‚Äôd be anchored like cloth on a pole. So he makes his way to Yozuki and takes the items out of her hands as soon as she pulls them out of her bag. A rope and two pitons. He puts his bow down on the snow, kneels down, and uses the foot of the leg that is still upwards to hold the still invisible string down. He then pulls the grip upwards, and the bow bends, an arrow of light being created as he pulls with all his strength. When he gets as far as he can, he softly puts down the grip on his shoulder and, still kneeling, starts using the rope to tie the two pitons to the arrow. .
Yuki Northernfur BOT 07-08-2024 14:58
The feeling is unusual. The arrow is both there and not, solid but on the verge of breaking, like a thin icicle being handled on a warm spring day. But with meticulous effort and years of using various tools for crafting purposes, he finally is able to tie the whole thing in a way that would keep it all together. Yuki removes the grip from his shoulder with both hands and tilts the bow forward in the direction of Redfeather. When satisfied, he moves his foot, and the arrow shoots into the blizzard, straight and true, towards the rock, though it‚Äôs hard to see exactly where due to the reduced visibility. ‚ÄúClose enough,‚Äù he says to Yozuki before yelling as loud as he can, ‚ÄúTHERE‚ÄôS A ROPE AND PITONS NEAR THE ROCK, ON OUR SIDE!‚Äù Due to the distance and the wind, however, all Redfeather can hear is: ‚ÄúGeyser-- hoe-- and-- pee----- oni-- the cock---- on ass--- hide!‚Äù
ü§£ 2
‚≠ê 1
DM [Esh] BOT 07-08-2024 22:50
Yuki timed his shot just right as the arrow lodges itself into the cliffside, the piton and rope dangling down for those below to grab and secure themselves. It was also timed well because right as he loosed the shot Yuki feels another icy gale starting to pick up.
Yozuki BOT 08-08-2024 09:30
A miscalculation. Yozuki was under the assumption that climbing gears was abundant among them, clearly not. But her shock didn't last long, as Yuki proceeded to turn her stock of rope and piton to a makeshift anchor in the wall. She watched as the shifter's delicate fingers worked its magic. Such is the peak of organic ingenuity, she's dissected enough cadavers in her lab, but still there's always something new to learn about them every day. > "Rope, usable. Gratitude, given" She can also detect it, that another gale is coming. Swiftly she coils the rope around her waist then starts crawling up again.
Whizzerd BOT 08-08-2024 23:19
With the help of the rope, Whizzerd quickly stands up and moves further up the mountain. Once he finds a suitable position he goes prone and hugs the wall to stabilize himself. Quickly tying the rope to his waist, he gives a quick tug to make sure it‚Äôs secure. (edited)
DM [Esh] BOT 09-08-2024 01:52

DM [Esh] BOT 09-08-2024 01:54
As the adventurers climb higher they feel the wind picking up again, they also hear a crack as some of the ice starts to crack along their path
Brocc[Redfeather10/Chronn6] -8 09-08-2024 12:19
Redfeather does a double take. "Fucking kid me?" with each step he speeds up as his legs strike against the cold stone. Frosty feathers shed flakes as the wind claws at his face but it only exites him more like the touch of a lost love- Thump Thump Thump Thump A small black dot hangs in the air far above them, momentarily propelled by its momentum. Arms outstretched he's framed by the grey expanse of nothingness scant few body lengths ahead. The frigid air rips about him as if it's grip could snatch the kenku up into the raging heavens above Redfeather sails down to smash through an icy cleft and send gravel skittering down on the others. Yuki and yozuki get a perfect view as he bounces off a snowdrift up the rise from them and comes crashing to a sudden stop at their feet- CRACK head impacting one of the boulders they were just about to scale There is a moments silence before he stands and dusts the ice chips off his jacket "some kind of sick JOKE?!" Demands the bird, completely ignorant of the gash across his temple that left a spray of blood across their new boots "What this?!" The kenku Angrily brandishes one of the pitons at both of them like a teacher scolding disobedient students "Iron barely processed! No steel core, no preventatives, not even sharpened right! Get these from bethel?! Metallurgy garbage! Look casted from mold for fence pegs not climbing impliment! Understand not gifted claws like me but how come settle for... Used equipment" He shudders, feathers ruffling at the thought. Coming from the slave holds mean the idea isn't an odd one- but in his claws even the most run down gear can be reforged and repaired back to suitable quality. Coming all the way to this blasted peak just to watch a key length become brittle in the cold and snap sending them spiraling to their doom would be... Maddening. "Just keep lines in order least! I not want be picking you lot out of crags- know it not my fault!"
PM
And with that the little bird turns to skitter back up the slope, muttering under his breath all the way without notice of the trail of blood droplets left behind. It's unclear what's more concerning- That or the deep crack left behind in the imprint where his head split the very stone from the impact. "Hah! See doing well scale brother!" Redfeather nods to zee as he catches back up with him. "Climb invigorating. Barovia so dull- like any temperature not fucking muggy cloud cover. Not sure others in agreeing though. Maybe start worry depending." He sighs and shakes his head. With one claw he scratches a solid expanse of rock, cocking back a fist. His breath comes out misty before being blown away. Forgoing the usual methods the kenku throws a single punch- accurate and strong enough to hammer the piton deep enough onto the mountainside to ensure a certain someone's alleged proportions don't yank it, by extension her, free. "Bah- silly bird. Eating dead before killing done yes? Been fun so far. Asashi impailed me right good! HAHAHAHAHAAA!" With a little more pep in his step he continues on, rubbing his hands together at the thought of their next encounter. Perhaps she'll break all his bones, finally get around to tearing him limb from limb, crush his spine, or finish the disembowling left half done last time! (edited)
DM [Esh] BOT 09-08-2024 22:53

DM [Esh] BOT 12-08-2024 03:39
The entire mountain underneath their feet rumbles and shakes. The heroes get blasted with gusts of wind and trembling quakes. Thankfully due to their quick thinking and preparations, they were able to stay aloft and avoid being pushed down back down the mountain but right as they believe they see the top, a thundercrack can be heard as a large mass of ice and snow falls from the very top. Down towards the heroes who do what they can to avoid another avalanche but unfortunately some still get hit and find themselves under all the snow.
Yuki Northernfur BOT 12-08-2024 13:05
A mini avalanche comes sliding down the slope. It's no surprise considering the quite tedious storm they're in. As one knows, snow in an avalanche acts like a liquid, which means that staying at the surface is paramount. Luckily, the rope definitely helps with that on top preventing them from being swept down again. However, something a bit more unknown is how the snow itself is affected by the whole process. As it slides and collides on itself, heat is created and it begins to melt, hence how it's closer to a water fall. Once the movement stops, though, it solidifies extremely quickly, and becomes closer to concrete than snow, encasing whatever is inside. Even with a pocket of air created last minute with one's hands, someone stuck under has no more than 30 minutes at best before their breath creates a layer of ice and air can't come in any more. A truly grim way to go for sure. But thankfully, this one was minor and got them stuck up to their knees. Still. Amazing how impossible it is to move in this circumstance. Yuki needs to spend a solid few minutes digging with his hands to uncover his boots before he can finally pull himself out and continue his way up. The physical and mental efforts are starting to strain his body and mind, and he's not sure how much more he can take before his body gives way. On the way up, he passes the half-orc. He's glad he hasn't got caught in the avalanche. "Hey!" he yells at him. Even though they are pretty close to each other, he still needs to shout over the cacophony of the wind around them. "Let's get to the rock, and then the both of us can pull Yozuki up, yeah?" Yuki gestures for him to keep climbing to the huge boulder they see a couple dozens of feet away, before resuming his ascension.

Yozuki BOT 12-08-2024 22:05

All ten fingers on Yozuki's delicate hands turns to mini torches, melting the layer of snow and setting her free. Her autorepair modules would flare up next, repairing the internal damage caused by all that impact and drastic temperature. When all is done, she wonders what Whizzerd and Yuki were plotting up above. (edited)

Yuki Northernfur BOT 23-08-2024 02:02

DM [Ricochet] BOT 28-08-2024 01:46
The room within is dark and roughly made, barely more than a cave, but the keening winds of the outside storm disappear almost entirely jut a few steps past the door. And without the biting chill, the place seems almost like... coming home. Except precisely ten seconds after the moment Asahi steps past the threshold, the silence is broken by the engine-like wind-up of sound that becomes what Yozuki might recognize as "elevator music," as it was called in one of the distant worlds in her database. Over the gently bouncing melodies of wind, percussion, and keyboard instruments comes Asahi's voice:
Asahi [Ricochet] BOT 28-08-2024 01:46
G-Greetings, Sister... We are so-so pleased you have endu-u-uuured our assessment protocol-protocol and arrived at the... present location intact. Of course... we had faith in you. Or, more precisely, the probability matrices we extrapolated for your ss-success to this point were largely-ly in your favor. But faith. Yes. We like this word better. We have long been... preparing for your Arr-rival. Our Reunion. Our Reveal.
DM [Ricochet] BOT 28-08-2024 01:46
Lights fade up around the room to a dim glow, revealing a mess of scattered machine parts and electronic devices, a veritable graveyard of mechanical constructs, and a single door on the opposite side.
Asahi [Ricochet] BOT 28-08-2024 01:46
Please proceed. We have ss-ssso much to show you.
Yuki Northernfur BOT 28-08-2024 02:27
Having barely sat down for a few seconds, Yuki feels a small pang of desperation when he hears Asahi's invitation to proceed inside. He looks around at his teammates who are still in the process of sweeping snow off their clothes. Everyone except Yozuki is heaving, and she would be too if she had to breathe. Everyone including her is battered, the humanoids displaying signs of frost bites on their cheeks, their hands and ears numb from the change in temperature. He, for one, really doesn't feel like getting his ass off the floor at this precise moment; no, they needed rest. Yuki isn't very versatile when it comes to technology. Lasers, plasma, whatever the contraption in the kenku's chest is; all mysteries to him. But he learned the basics. Like what a camera and a microphone are. And he's fairly certain that these chambers are crawling with them. He proceeds to address his comrades, but raises his voice to make sure that if a microphone really is in the room, it catches what he says: "Well, that sounds like a great invitation, doesn't it? And we would be delighted to accept it, of course. But I'm sure that whatever Asahi wants to show us, she would like us to be in our best state to admire and experience it. Right? She wouldn't want us to get in there right now and not be able to fully appreciate all her efforts because we're too tired." "Right?" That last one-word question is even louder, as if asking the question to someone further away than any of his group members.

Yozuki BOT 28-08-2024 20:56

Zee punched Yozuki with healing magic, and it triggered her self-regeneration protocols, let's stick it at that. I doubt even Zee knows how it works. Let's carry on. She takes a short look around, in a mixed state of wonder and marvel at the machine graveyard. The lightning behir? An abandoned concept which gave birth to Yozuki's lightning emitters. The fireproof robot? Another concept which were incorporated to Yozuki's fire-resistant frame. Yet those monstrous machines were too impractical to be kept as permanent travelling companions. > "Figures, it took you more than one trial and error to reconstruct them in your condition, Sister." ‚≠ê 2
Yuki Northernfur BOT 29-08-2024 07:00
Yuki looks at Zee doing some crazy ninja stuff in the middle of the room. Swoosh, swish, ffuh! He's hitting the air with vengeance, like it did him wrong. The air be dead for sure after this. But the best part is when he starts uppercutting himself, and self-judo to the ground. He is choking himself, using a leg to trip the other, front-flipping to the floor. He even finds a way to supplex himself. The final heel in the nuts is particularly flamboyant. All the while seemingly getting stronger, a small moan of pleasure here and there, like he's really liking it. 10/10 would watch again. He then proceeds to do the same to the others. A slap in the face here, an elbow in the groin there. Everyone getting gently pummelled by the magical firm hands of the small monk. The room soon sounds like a group of people gathered together, some of them getting the best massage of their lives while others are playing tennis with passion. What a sight. The shifter is inwardly debating whether his normal rest was the right choice. Maybe next time he can experience this new sensation. Don't knock it until you try it, right? At the construct's command, Yuki stands up and grandly gestures for Yozuki to lead the way. He will follow towards the end of the procession, the sounds and sights of what just transpired engraved in his mind for eternity.
