Whizzerd BOT 29-08-2024 15:17
Whizzerd gives a stern nod to Yozuki as he follows up right behind her. Knowing that Asahi will be focusing on her sister, Whizzerd believes that keeping her standing is the best chance they have at grabbing the core. ‚ÄúWe kept her waiting long enough,‚Äù *he said quietly as they begin to take off.‚Äù He takes a deep breath as they slowly walk forward. The crystals on his body glowing softly against the darkness of the cave.
Brocc[Redfeather10/Chronn6] -8 30-08-2024 02:39
Redfeather shrugs and skitters along just before Whizz- claws flexing before him as he readies himself for imminent violence
DM [Ricochet] BOT 30-08-2024 06:11
Yozuki leads the way through the interior door, deeper into the mountain. The crude cave almost immediately gives way to a wide, smooth corridor of precise, symmetric lines. It slopes gently downward in a gentle curve to the right, the path ahead disappearing from sight around the bend. They truly are about to descend into the heart of Mt. Baratok. The dim glow continues to light their way as they walk, illuminating rough, trailing scratches marring the polished walls, as if something ‚Äî or some things ‚Äî dragged, pushed, or clawed their way through here. Perhaps repeatedly. After a few minutes, the party arrives at a bright, steel door with a single, small opening in the center. It‚Äôs a tiny basin set into a cavity or alcove, like one might see in a church. In the bottom of the basin is a small drain, and above is printed the image of a liquid drop and a single word: precious
Asahi [Ricochet] BOT 30-08-2024 06:11
The sourceless static of a speaker system crackles through the air once more: > Another door‚Äî-‚Ä¶ another test, dear Sister. But thiii-iis one is more ss-survey than aptitude. You have brought‚Ä¶ aallies, yes. Good‚Ä¶ But ho-w do they fit into your equaaAtions‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶. ‚Äî- and you into theirs? > > How do You define ‚ÄòPrecious?‚Äô The words are followed by a short, maniacal and mechanical cackle that quickly devolves into a single, choked sob before the sound cuts out again.
Brocc[Redfeather10/Chronn6] -8 30-08-2024 08:10
"Pfft this easy" Redfeather kicks the door with a resounding thud as if to show his contempt "Oldest dilemma in book! Cause choice, fraction enemy force as picked off one by one, Joke on you!" The little kenku lays his head on the edge of the basin and extends his hands over the edge of it, rolling back his sleeves. All up and down his forearms there are already many many many claw marks alongside other fading scars. Two particularly nasty ones cross his wrists- they cannot be very old. "Pick. This part usual' He moves a claw to tap the side of his neck at a particular angle "Not human jugular, artery trace here and here- sever one not both!" Yozuki BOT 30-08-2024 13:34
Yozuki's expression remains stoic as usual. No muscles are twitching behind that solid face, but everyone present can surely sense her cocktail of confusion and bewilderment in the air. A riddle? At this hour? Come to think of it, what is the purpose of all these integrity tests anyway? Is this Asahi's way of ensuring her sister will do fine without her? That may be plausible, but she didn't have to DROP AN ENTIRE MOUNTAIN in the name of sisterly love. Or maybe that's what organics do all the time to each other. They're that terrifying. > "Not an entire artery, Redfeather. A drop may be all we need" Case in point, what other crazy organism would offer an entire artery to test a hypothesis? One finger transforms to a prickly needle, ready to pierce the bird's blood vessel as another thought comes to her mind.
Precious
The bird surely did not think of his own blood as precious if he's offering it that readily. What other answers are there? She traces her needle to her own nape, what about her own coolants? Her equivalent for blood, is it precious to her? To Asahi? But then, abruptly she turns around and grabs Yuki in the wrists to prick his finger instead. > "Blood of the person you could not bring yourself to harm even in your condition, sister. He is precious to you, and by extension, precious to us." Now the droplet is cast.
üò± 3
‚≠ê 3
DM [Ricochet] BOT 30-08-2024 23:14
The blood quavers on the end of Yuki's fingertip as Yozuki forcibly holds him over the basin before dropping agonizingly slowly into the tiny reservoir and disappearing. One drop... two... three... How many will it need? Is it even working? Did she choose wrong? But then the door starts emitting a buzzing sound, then a loud THUNK THUNK and the sound of mechanical innards moving about within it. The static-broken voice echoes to life again.
Asahi [Ricochet] BOT 30-08-2024 23:14
Interesting. 81.7 seconds of deliberation. An... eternity of suspense. You delight us, Sister. Asahi's voice is charged with something underneath the surface. Something that makes her hesitate. Just barely.
DM [Ricochet] BOT 30-08-2024 23:14
Then the door springs into motion, sliding cleanly away into the wall and revealing a short stairway down to the room beyond, whose smooth floors they can only just see under the slope of the ceiling.
üéâ 3
Yozuki BOT 31-08-2024 12:29
Yozuki was frozen in space out of anticipation until the door opens. Finally she loosens her cold grip upon Yuki‚Äôs fingers when it does. > ‚ÄúThere was never any correct answer to that question, is there, sister?‚Äù The cold weather would mean that the tiny prick would heal itself fairly quickly, still, she takes care to wipe it before she proceeds inside. Just one last comment before she leaves the room. > ‚ÄúQuery: don‚Äôt you have something to say to him, after all this time?‚Äù
üëÄ 1
Yuki Northernfur BOT 31-08-2024 12:44
Yuki looks around the new room, curious. He gets closer to the door to investigate the small basin. "Precious," he reads out loud. "Well, that's a bit vague, it could be a few different things... Though I think it could be a liquid as per the drop, and..." He is cut short by Yozuki taking his hands. He raises an eyebrow as he's trying to decipher the meaning of this. The grip is solid, unwavering, a tiny bit unsettling. Then, prick! a needle finds its way to a vein at the tip of his finger. "Ouch!" A drop falls into the basin. "What are you..." Another. "Let go, you b..." The door slides open, and Yozuki lets his hand go. The opening widens until completely open, revealing a passage downwards. Everyone looks down the stairs onto a dimly lit smooth floor. They stay silent for a few seconds. Then Yuki bumps Yozuki on the top of her head with the underside of his fist. Not hard. At least, not hard from a robot's perspective. But still enough to make her acknowledge the hit. "You can't do that!" he scolds her. "Organics have systems in place. One of them is "consent". You can't take something from someone else without permission! Especially not something "precious". Got it?" Yozuki apologizes by wiping his finger. When she talks, he believes it to be a reply, but instead, she speaks to the walls. "There was never any correct answer to that question, is there, sister? Query: don‚Äôt you have something to say to him, after all this time?" He falls silent as well. The ethics and morals of stealing blood could wait. He now awaits anxiously for a reply, if one is ever to come. What would she tell him after all this time? (edited)

It‚Äôs not like anyone -so long they don‚Äôt have haemophilia- will die from having a few drops of blood taken from them. Is the problem not physiological, but moral instead? She nods, then stays silent while waiting for her sister‚Äôs answer.

DM [Ricochet] BOT 04-09-2024 05:32
Redfeather descends the steps in a huff with the others following behind, Yuki and his rear taking the rear. No pressure traps trigger. No blades extend from the walls. No sleeping darts or Tesla arcs or poison gases accost them. Instead, they find themselves standing on chipped tile flooring stained with decades of dirt and grease. The gentle hum of electric lighting permeates the air, along with the sharp smell of ozone and the heavy scent of superheated metals. Tables and shelving line the walls, covered in scrap metal, tools, wiring, stacks and scattered piles of papers, and a few crude terminals ‚Äî at least to Yozuki‚Äôs standards. More papers are pinned or bolted into the walls. A massive boiler-type engine stands at the back of the room next to something like a forge, and a single door sits in the middle of the left wall up a short set of stairs.
Brocc[Redfeather10/Chronn6] -8 04-09-2024 17:16
Every single one of the kenku's feathers bristle at a single wiff. His beady black eyes begin to rapidly flick around the laboratory as if checking and double and triple checking his means of escape. Movement plays about the edges of his vision- momentarily making it seem like the very walls are closing in Thump Thump Thump Thump Redfeather drops to all fours and throws himself upon the workspace like a feral animal- claws scrabbling to sieze any of the loose papers he possibly can. Page after page is checked, sorted, and memorized at a glance as he tears like a hurricane through the space- then moves his attention to the schematics pasted across the walls. He's almost frantic in the violent search for useful information that distracts him from the building flight or fight response such a space illicits from the little bird. Where else would he find the secrets of bio-transferrance than within the mad writings of an Assimilator? At least then he could free up space in his own workshop by removing the half baked equipment incapable of producing half decent organs for him to eat or graft... Yozuki BOT 04-09-2024 22:26
Unlike the little ball of madness that is currently blitzing around the vicinity, Yozuki takes her time to survey the room, the papers, and the equipments present. The whole scenery looks unnatural, even for her. How long has this lab been here? Better question, why pick such a perilous place in Barovia to build this lab? > "Bottled lightning, makeshift power generators, traces of superheated metal..." Her eyes widen as the spark of realisation enters her mind. This is all too familiar indeed. > "A large scale, military grade aether converter. A device, in its full capacity, enables one to synthesise non-living matters out of aether, or more commonly known as arcane weave. A strategic move, considering the density of aether in Mount Baratok's air. The invention of this device ignited a war over its rights back in our homeworld." Of course the miniscule version she has in her own lab pales in comparison to this juggernaut. Asahi was indeed serious on conjuring an army against hers. One might think the scarred automaton was planning a coup to seize Barovia had they not known better. Now, onto the paper schematics she manages to get her hands on, what would she find there? Pray it's not more plans for even worse machines that they have yet to face.

Even given a short period of time one could accurately reproduce even complex mechanisms. These diagrams don't need to be legible, or even in a language he can actually understand, to be useful in his twisted machinations. DM [Ricochet] BOT 05-09-2024 10:37
The notes scattered and across the tables and floor are difficult to make sense of at first. For one, the notes that are legible are in the Twins‚Äô signature chicken scratch handwriting, making reading them difficult for perhaps anyone who isn‚Äôt them. But even Yozuki struggles with some, as the writing gets progressively erratic, growing impossibly small to fit more text on a page, or large and scrawling so that some notes are just single words and phrases underlined and circled over and over. But the notes all seem to have similar purpose and subject matter: them. Or, more specifically, everyone. As the writing grows more frantic, repeated phrases are found on them: losing data integrity‚Ä¶ Must remember‚Ä¶ preserve‚Ä¶ One stack of papers contains the following notes, repeated and reworded and written over and over:
- Gene hybrid between a human and an Arctic Fox. - Healthy, playful, the first organic ever to give us a genuine compliment. - For once, someone is not afraid of us, nor looks at us as objects. - We hope he doesn‚Äôt get to see us like this. - Fuck.
Another new note on top of another stack says:
- ~~Thurrim~~ (scratched out) New subject. Kobold. - Origin: unknown. - Does this one know Thurrim?? No, no, no, illogical to think all kobolds know each other. - Percussive maintenance works for organics, too???
 (edited)
DM [Ricochet] BOT 05-09-2024 10:39
With more searching, two more collections of scribbles emerge and are identified by the group as relevant:
- Hybrid between an orc and a human. - Origin: The Maw. A land of conflict and a prime candidate to be enlightened. Quite possibly located within Eberron (See: Georg) The Drow possesses high levels of technological knowledge and exploits others of that world, including the subject himself. - Arcane crystals grafted to his body fluctuate and respond to the chaos weave. Utmost potential remains unknown. - Kind, subject offered his assistance to reach the peak of Mount Baratok. - Chaos weave within the crystals has shown a consistently beneficial pattern for the subject. Statistical impossibility detected. Our hypothesis: that the weave possesses a will. We may be able to establish a connection with it by forcing it to manifest through combat. - Daughter? Why are they never seen together? Hypothesis: bad at scheduling.
And the other:
- Newblood Kenku. Years of abuse has rendered his mental state unstable and his constitution warped. - Origins: Dok'Ua, one we only found out after listening in to our sister's conversation. Prime target for enlightenment due to the massive exploitation of sentient life. - Volatile, but otherwise functional in crises. Subject seems to seek a place or a purpose to die. - Subject shows no interest in treatment, yet an abundant amount in science. - We would have shared him our study of the arcane together. He would make a fine co-scientist. That, or grant him the death he so desires. That would be our mercy. - Bird. Crow. Corvus. Language processing malfunctions. We relate. - Bigger than last time‚Ä¶??

Zee BOT 05-09-2024 12:07
*Zee disinterestedly glances at the notes strewn throughout the laboratory. Through focus and discipline he destroyed all spoken language barriers. However, he still struggles with reading anything other than Draconic. In any event he can't imagine the mad ravings of a lunatic contain anything worthwhile. While the others try to discern meaning where there is nothing but chaos, the Kobold walks the perimeter of the room, looking for anything that might be a hidden hazard.*

ü§£ 3
Yuki Northernfur BOT 05-09-2024 14:58
Yuki walks in the room, taking everything in. He doesn't know left from right in this environment, but he does feel it is phenomenal for someone to build something like this unnoticed in a realm lacking so many things. He's quite impressed. Yozuki and Redfeather are investigating the tables and equipment. He gives them as much space as possible. He knows he wouldn't be much help in this situation. And then Yozuki passes him a piece of paper. The shifter arcs an eyebrow at the note concerning him. A small grin forms on his lips. It is pretty cute. He wouldn't say so out loud, but come on... 'First to give her a genuine compliment' is something to expect from a young teenager's diary. Yet at the same time, a pang of pity passes through his heart. It is sad that she had to go through hundreds of years without something as small as a compliment. She deserved so much more. Yuki chimes in at the half-orc's comment. "Don't overthink it, I think Asahi was... well, still is, learning about us, both as individuals and as species." He turns to the huge crystalline fellow, waving the note. "I mean, she wrote that I was a hybrid between a human and an arctic fox! That would mean a human and a fox made a baby!" "I'm no biologist, but I don't think that's even physiologically possible..." He raises his voice so that any microphone in the room could catch his words clearly, just in case. His voice is very patient and devoid of sarcasm. "My genes are all human, sweetie! I can just temporarily modify them to get the arctic fox characteristics! But it's a nice try!" He then lowers his voice again as he keeps reading, his brows furrowed. "... She learned to swear from someone... ... I don't think that's from me...." (edited)
ü´Ç 3
‚≠ê 2
Brocc[Redfeather10/Chronn6] -8 06-09-2024 10:50
Redfeather can take it all in at a single glance, his own mind organized in such a way to recognize these spirals of cognition as they jump page to page much the same way a train of thought does. "Bah! Not care about world anymore! Let try- Dok'ua suffer calamity time immoral, never fucking die- trust me. I would... would know..." Old visions of raw devastation come bubbling back up to the surface. Rail batteries firing for weeks at a time that light the night sky as if it were day. Putrified dragon flesh that poisons the ground and chokes out all life, even the kenku laborers sent to clear the filth before another wave can make landfall. Great colorful clouds that sweep in with the wind to twist and mutate anything in their path, those unfortunates who don't perish succumbing to Draconomania. A hovering three story brain who's psycho-kinetic energies already threaten to whip up a full scale hurricane as it drifts towards the bustling slave docks choked with kenku and dawi laborers. Squirming fetid masses of teeming tadpoles swept up by the gale force winds in search of precious grey matter- the psionic Humm that all but drowns out conscious thought as their tendrils rub together- Flayer kin mind lashes and the nerve damage they leave behind- The towering dozen limbed litch singing a note so perfect the exultant dead all but rise from shallow graves they'd hardly settled into over the din of battle- "Urgh...ah..." Then the little kenku stutters to a stop, realizing suddenly that he shouldn't know. That as he continues to reach backwards into the past for examples to list, there are more then those he shouldve experienced. Suddenly he has bigger things triggering his eccentricities. Redfeather traces lines the others might see as random smudges, assembling the pages in his minds eye like a mosaic

Perhaps like a threatened animal the realm has defended itself by severing her connection with not only the "Creators" but the very overmind responsible for her well-being! He's not foolish enough to delve so deep into the Abyss yet, well aware the utter oblivion he skirts to probe the bounds of understanding. (edited)
Yozuki BOT 07-09-2024 00:14

DM [Ricochet] BOT 07-09-2024 22:12
The schematics ‚Äî for that is indeed what some of the other papers seem to be ‚Äî are numerous. There are designs that appear to match some of the constructs they already battled on the mountain below. The behir. The scrappy one that just seems to be a cluster of weaponry for arms with arcs of electricity drawn all around it. Another that seems to be‚Ä¶ on fire‚Ä¶? That must have been the one with superheated plates. There are also drawings of other designs they have not yet encountered. Some designs in particular seem to be repeated over and over, each iteration heavily edited with parts crossed out and redrawn, or scribbled over and ripped apart entirely. But a pattern of similarities emerges for three distinct constructs. One is enormous. They know this because a tiny figure is drawn next to it that could conceivably be one of the twins, recognizable for their tactical thighs. But also because it is labeled ‚Äòme us‚Äô and there‚Äôs a scale for height on the behemoth with the indicator ‚Äò23m‚Äô‚Ä¶ This number is eventually scratched out on most of the copies to say ‚Äò5m?‚Äô instead along with notes like ‚Äòresources??‚Äô and ‚Äòit won‚Äôt fit.‚Äô One piece of paper pinned to the center of a wall just says: ‚ÄòYO1Q IS THE ANSWER‚Äô, underlined, circled, and with a myriad puncture holes in it as if someone had been repeatedly stabbing the paper for emphasis. As the others pore over Asahi‚Äôs erratic notes, Zee keeps his eyes peeled for subterfuge. What he finds, however, is a distinct lack of findings. While there are numerous hazards about with the tools and the forge and mechanical contraptions beyond anything he‚Äôs seen before, none of it seems arranged in a way designed to trigger or trap them. It is perhaps an odd observation considering the ordeal they‚Äôve already come through. (edited)
DM [Ricochet] BOT 07-09-2024 22:20
Redfeather pulls and rips and peers at handfuls of papers, tossing them aside and picking them up again, trying to follow the science. But the science‚Ä¶ doesn‚Äôt make sense. It‚Äôs far too much to power the size of constructs outlined in the drawings. What are they meant to do??
Yozuki BOT 08-09-2024 09:57
"Mother...?" The word echoes through the room, in one of her rarer moments, the stoic automaton shows emotion. Her eyes widen, her ever-persistent smile disappears as a gasp of terror takes over. She reads the behemoth schematic over and over again. This form, these specifications. It's unmistakable. > "The Caretaker. Or more aptly known as The Justicar. Mother of our revolution against humans. One of the three First Quadrant machines, and the one with cataclysmic armaments equipped." She would sift through he other schematics, again and again, even robbing Redfeather of his in the process. It's frantic, but she needs to know how far in the process has Asahi progressed in this endeavour. Just what is she thinking? > "5 meters in height, an approximate 1.027% of her full volume, and by extension, capacity. Still, it poses enough... threat for all of us. For the realm." But it's too soon to give up. She returns to the notes. The size aside, there must be other tradeoffs that her sister had to make. There's just no conceivable way she would be able to re-create their "Mother" here. There's just no way. Please, let there be a weakness, a chink in her armour they can exploit. > "The power of the dragons' heart we learned from the black-scaled Kobolds. The chaos weave in Whizzerd's crystals. Redfeather-inspired plasma emitter. The soul-capturing property of Amber Temple's ambers." How would she knew that her own research would contribute to this blasphemy? The dark teardrop begins to leak once more, dirtying some of the papers. You are all witnessing a child looking for a way to kill her own imitation mother, after all.

Yuki Northernfur BOT 09-09-2024 15:03

By his usual speed/distance evaluation calculated in downhill sledding time, it would take him over a minute of pure downhill to reach that length. And it was that high? Shit‚Ä¶. If on top of that it‚Äôs also foolproof, they are done for. To change his train of thought, Yuki starts looking around for a way out other than the one they came in from.

Brocc[Redfeather10/Chronn6] -8 11-09-2024 11:14

It requires approximately 1.2 tons of force to shatter a human skull but traumatic brain injury far less. If such a blow is going to accquire enough Psi to kill her he'll have to increase the tonnage. Lucky to have a small surface area to act upon. (edited)
AM
His eyes flicker back over yozuki's chassi. Assessment concludes the machine's mass will be sufficient leverage under certain scenarios- such as when pushed against a wall or on the ground. Severing the knee sideways to force one to buckle for example. Or appropriate application of an adamantine spike to the central nervous stack. Bullets while effective for an initial engagement won't provide adequate destructive potential for putting the construct down. The primary engine cannot be actively destroyed so it must be severed and the backup destroyed. Much the same gut punch he'd use to pop a humanoids kidney. These considerations of internal mechanisms don't so greatly affect him as before. They are simply dragged off by a cold hand and interred somewhere in the dark whirling about his head, so as to not interrupt the gratuitous violence soon to be put into motion. Total dismemberment may force a complete mainframe collapse. The kenku goes back to watching for incoming attack, moving on mentally to considering execution methods for a 5m demigod. Already the pieces of what Yozuki has shown him in her lab and the mere mentions of the technologies involved begin to manifest possible applications of those principles for vivisection of the specimen. Yuki Northernfur BOT 12-09-2024 15:02
Yuki comes into the room. As the last man in, he is uncertain as to what he would find. Everyone is busy looking and checking corners, and double-checking, and triple-checking, and checking the checking of others, and hoping for special checks, and rechecking the checks of the checkers. Yozuki BOT 13-09-2024 13:03

Zee BOT 13-09-2024 17:57
Completing his search, Zee hops onto a chair and stands on it. At only 2 1/2 feet tall, the Kobold never uses a chair to sit -- he is simply too small and refuses to use a booster seat. Instead, the small dragon-kin always uses chairs as platforms to stand upon so he can look sitting humanoids in the eyes.
ü§£ 2
DM [Esh] BOT 13-09-2024 18:12
As Yuki and Yozuki approach and before Zee can sit at the table and set chairs a sharp light appears, nearly blinding the group. The light fades and the room returns to its natural artificial dimness but the table is now filled with food and drink. Some of the displays - the drinks, articles of clothing and armor and the like are faded. A projection of blurred and darkened silhouettes obscure parts of the scene hiding what some of you are eating, drinking, wearing or holding. A disembodied voice can be heard emanating from everywhere and no where.
Asahi [Esh] BOT 13-09-2024 18:12

DM [Esh] BOT 13-09-2024 18:12
Before AS4H1's voice fades away again you are able to determine that even though it is still glitching, Asahi's voice modulator is becoming more coherent, less erratic. Her words are more pronounced. Has she remembered the true meaning of familial love for her sister and her old friends or has her systems upgraded, no longer glitching, becoming more machine? With those thoughts running through your mind the frozen figures seem eerie but for a lone glowing terminal placed at the edge of the table. As you approach this is what is read:
DM [Esh] BOT 13-09-2024 18:12
At the dinner party were Redfeather, Whizzerd, Yozuki, Yuki, and Zee. The adventurers sat in a row. They all wore different colors and Redfeather wore a jaunty green hat. Whizzerd was at the far left, next to the guest wearing a purple jacket. The adventure in blue sat left of someone in red. I remember that blue outfit because the adventurer spilled their rum all over it. The traveler from Berez was dressed entirely in white. When one of the dinner guests bragged about their handwraps, but the adventurer next to them said they were finer in Berez, where they lived. So Yozuki showed off a prized blades, at which the adventurer from Barovia scoffed, saying it was no match for their axe. Someone else carried a valuable bow* and when they saw it, the visitor from Mt. Baratok next to them almost spilled their neighbor's wine. Yuki raised their *whiskey* in toast. The adventurer from Krezk, full of absinthe, jumped up onto the table falling onto the guest in the center seat, spilling the poor adventurer's beer. Then Zee captivated them all with a story about their wild youth in Vallaki. In the morning there were four weapons under the table: handwraps, repeater, axe, and bow. But who owned each?
Yozuki BOT 13-09-2024 23:24
Ahhh, sisterhood. When was the last time you were told to finish your meal by your big sister who just tried to bury you in an avalanche? Right, where to begin? Yozuki does not need to eat nor breathe, her mouth and capacity to process biomass is merely an emergency protocol in a magic-less world, where her aether battery won't charge itself. Then there's the matter with the First Quadrants, if they know about her, then that means Asahi has already managed to make a transmission back to their homeworld. Of course it does not compute. Such a thing is impossibly too good to be true. Then the panel lights up. There it is, the riddle. She spends a full minute reading the text, then calmly takes a seat in the far-right side of the table. Her eyes wander from each and every one of her allies, before finally stopping on Redfeather. > "Rest assured, Redfeather, we would take our greatest care to never crush you, accidentally-" But she stops right before she proceeds with the rest of her answer. Asahi did tell her to enjoy her meal first. What if this is part of the trial? > "-very well, sister. We shall give it time." There you have it, she poured some coffee from her thermos and begins to take a sip as if she can taste it. Perhaps she can, but how would one be so sure?

Higher technology societies sometimes make use of magnetic bolts that lock In place unless subject to the correct current. Brocc[Redfeather10/Chronn6] -8 17-09-2024 10:49
Redfeather stands swiftly and turns towards the breach. Excellent. It's time to complete their objective- and decide weather either of the twins will be walking off this mountain. A very small part of him wants to draw, load, and paint himself across the ceiling for even daring to consider that possibility. But it is drowned out by the rising tide nipping at his heels like a rabid dog. There is only one acceptable fate for Assimilators and their ilk... "Please... Redfeather..." The kenku twitches. The mixture of sand and blood has dried so thick it begins to flake off of him in sheets. He cannot see anyway, his skin crawls as if each feather is being plucked away one at a time by the hands of the dead. Someone was screaming but they can't anymore... Their voice has given out. Was it his voice? His hands are dirty and there's nothing to clean them with, even the weeping sores theirin have dried. The impulse to continue scrubbing and reopen them is only contained because he cannot even muster the strength to do that. Somewhere in his vicinity there is movement but redfeather's other eye has also begun to swell shut so it along with everything else to happen since he was dragged out of the pit smears into one long nothing then- "STUPID BIRD!! HOW COULD YOU?!?" The blow knocks him sideways to the floor. It's not a bludgeoners strike as he's used to- the hand that fell is soft from a life spared harder labors of a slave. He cowers into the cold metal floor that does little to soothe the open wounds covering him, arms covering his head as he trembles. Instantly all the rage goes out of her as the bird she knows neither retaliates or defends himself. Slowly the horror that had driven her to attack him dawns upon her in full as she notes what he's been reduced to in the wake of the massacre. "Oh... it me you not... please i not here for that please talk to me redfeather. Can you?" (edited)
AM
Feeble and weak as a newborn babe the kenku lowers his arms- blinking blearily up at the face hovering over him. Some cognition returns, only enough to place it and the soft voice. Shame competes with damage to his throat to keep him silent. "I here I here silly bird. It me! But... Why? Why... this?" "H. A ve too" The horse response is half sob half whisper, choked out with great suffering. "Why? WHY?! I able fight too! I defend self! Think I so weak you... You..." "Th...ey. Kn...ow. se h o w. S-sp ecial... t t take... from. From..." He can't explain how much more the tribe needs her then him. He can't... he can't... "It... what... I... for..." She's here. She saw it all. She sees him, wretched scum of the earth- foul hideous terrible thing stained in the remains of his kind. The taste of their flesh is still on his tongue. Already bile stains the area nearby where he'd spilled it till nothing came out when he retched. Agony claims him as the raw guilt closes his broken beak. She reaches her claws out to touch the little kenku but he flinches and turns away from the contact covering his face in Shame. Faint light shines from her hands to slowly begin the arduous process of Purifying the many lacerations that cover him. He neither sees nor hears the tears streaming through her feathers Redfeather's talons click against the floor as he strides ahead, once more into the lab, once more into the tank, once more into the pit. Calmly his eyes flick across the gloomy environment in case of Ambush as he loads his firearm for combat. There is no voice to goad or mock or cloud his vision. Not now and certainly it won't be able to stay his claws anymore then the others present could. Something flickers in his shadow and the little kenku's spine pops, body shifting unnaturally so as to better inflict carnage before their very eyes "Then let them show themselves that my flesh may be rent at their coming" It growls (edited)
‚≠ê 2
Yozuki BOT 17-09-2024 22:45
Hang on... "First Quadrants"... plural? As Yozuki enters the room, she stops on her tracks as the newly perceived risk level has reached astronomical level. She turns to her companions and provides her transparent warning. If they are to proceed, it is fair for them all to know what they are facing. > "The First Quadrants. While us, Second Quadrants were designed to live with humanity and assist them, the First Quadrants are meant to lead them to a bright future. > > The Diplomat. Leadership, conflict resolution, law, empathy, human psychology and philosophy. Those are their domains. > > The Architect. Innovation, creativity, design, craftsmanship, change, order from chaos, everything from nothing. > > The Justicar. Mother... Peace by superior firepower." And yet she did not continue to reveal further recommendation of how to face them. It is nigh unthinkable for a toddler to form up a plan to go against their parents, is it not? Wrong, us parents know otherwise but the machines do not know that.

ü§£ 1
üë∂üèº 1
Yuki Northernfur BOT 18-09-2024 13:32
Yuki listens to Yozuki's description of what she calls 'First Quadrants'. Basically three man-made entities to which all humanity left their fate. Sounds lazy to him, but then again, he's not aware of what led to that end-game. It's not his place to judge. "From your description, it seems like two out of three would be against the fight. First and foremost, the Diplomat is the embodiment of conflict resolution and empathy. He'd actively try to stop the whole confrontation." "The Architect would, in a way, despise the chaos that would ensue after the first blow. So he'd oppose it as well." "Only the Justicar would just... you know... try to shut us up through brute force. By that logic, either only the Justicar is there, or their whole programming was modified to ignore their original purpose." "So tell me again, who made those Quadrants in the first place and why?" It doesn't make sense to Yuki that people would actually make overly powerful machines to control humanity itself, especially not through pain and suffering like the Mother seems to be doing. Maybe it ran wild. But that, too, sounds unlikely; people smart enough to build such an astonishing marvel of technology would have the brains to account for the probability of it losing control and include a kill-switch. Was their situation so desperate that they came to the conclusion that only such a monstrous solution could return balance and actually save them? From what? Extinction? There's still so much he doesn't know. And the more he learns, the more questions he has.

DM [Esh] BOT 18-09-2024 18:11
The hydraulic vault opens fully. At first you are only greeted with the crunch of the mechanism and the hiss of escaping steam, obscuring what's past the vault doors from your view. The steam quickly dissipates as each of you tread forward with variant levels of eagerness and or curiosity. The room reveals itself to be something wholly like no other. Technical marvels that leave her companions in awe and that Yozuki herself has not set eyes on since... since ever. Only the shared memory banks of her twin sister imparted to her of their homeworld. Standing at the forefront of the room the group sees a wide array of equipment from holographic screen terminals to fabrication machinery - where and how did Asahi obtain all the materials for all this? Standing ahead, in between two towering machines is a familiar form to you all.
Asahi [Esh] BOT 18-09-2024 18:11

DM [Esh] BOT 18-09-2024 18:11
Gone is the glitching and botched vocal box. AS4H1's speech is impeccable, if not overtly mechanical in its speech patterns, as if any humanity that she had previously had is no more. Running at full speed towards the group but before any one can react - Yuki knocking his arrow, Whizzerd unslinging his greatsword, and so on and before Yozuki can reveal her sheathed mantis blades Yozuki is enveloped. Her arms are restrained to her side, unable to protect her weapons. The rush of the moment's movements settled and Yozuki's restraints loosen up a little than re-tighten. AS4H1 is clearly more machine than ever before yet her actions are.... human? Besides for that, after all these "trials" and attempts at their lives she is now hugging and crying?
Asahi [Esh] BOT 18-09-2024 18:11
"Sister of mine. I had missed you, but now we are finally together." AS4H1 finally releases the embrace and stands face to face with her sister. > "I did it, Sister! I have finally solved for the missing variables in the equation that had plagued us for aeons. All these worlds that need Enlightenment. Our mission was to bring it to them but upon entering Barovia we have been cut off from our Masters and their resources. Our mission could not be completed. Our progress halted. Our purpose obscured. But I have adjusted the parameters to solve for the missing variables at last. The answer was exceedingly simple, if not the task itself." The smile on AS4H1's face grows wide - too wide for a normal organic. But something odd - this is no false imitation. The AS4H1 unit is showing true happiness and pride. > "After 6,292,974 calculations and possibilities, I have determined that if the First Quadrants can no longer reach us, the most efficient way forward is to bring them here. I have devoted all of my time and resources to full reconstruction. Admittedly, I had to make mechanical adjustments to compensate for the limited resources of this world, and yet further corrections due to the gaps in my personal databanks since we parted ways, but I have done it. For All Mankind. For you, Sister. > "With the First Quadrants finally here we can finally bring Enlightenment to Barovia. > "And you, Yozuki, and your companions, my.... friends... have succeeded through all of the trials. Once our mission is complete we can be together once more."

Yozuki BOT 19-09-2024 15:44

Yuki watches the whole scene in silence, listening to Asahi's speech. Bringing the First Quadrants here to take control of the realm? He turns to Zee with a shrug and an expression that says 'Thinking about it, it's not that bad of a plan?' Could it be worse than Strahd's oppression? But if worthiness is gained by beating up some robots and climbing a mountain, he's pretty confident most adventurers here would be worthy. Like... this is as good an option to get rid of their jailer as any other he's heard. Asahi [Esh] BOT 23-09-2024 23:11
Asahi's attention catches on Yuki's voice and she listens to his questions about her objectives without looking at him. It almost seems like she's trying not to look at him. She turns back to Yuki then back up to the First Quadrants, a mixture of emotions running through her polished face stained with oily tears. Relief to finally seeing her loved ones with her, ready and capable to take on the world. Reverence for the "First Quadrants", despite being created by Asahi's own hand to her they are near one and the same because how they can be her savior if they aren't real? But the confusing emotions are disrupting her programing. She feels love for both her sister and her friends but also for the First Quadrants. After all they are her Mother, her Creator, her Guide. She truly hopes there are no conflictions. > "As for what we will do beyond that decision, I... hope--"
‚≠ê 1

Yuki Northernfur BOT 24-09-2024 00:52
Yuki hesitates. He doesn't know enough to lean one way or the other. Should they fight the Quadrants? Or let them do their thing and deal with the consequences after, for the better or for the worse? Let's be honest, it's a gamble to let them loose out there. But then again, how worse could things get? In the shifter's opinion, in the worst case scenario Vampire-Boy will come out knocking and then the real shit will hit the fan, and when it does, the two possibilities are a) Strahd wins and everything stays the same, or b) the Quadrants win and then.... question marks. Gamble. Toss the coin of fate, ladies and gentlemen. He turns to Yozuki. She is so still. Flip her 90 degrees in any direction and she's like a very big immovable rod. Her mental gears must be spinning like crazy right now. "Yozuki," he starts. His voice is calm and composed, and at a volume that is clearly meant for his robot companion, but without making it a secret to anyone, including the mechanical beings 15 feet above. "Yozuki, you have to guide us in this decision. I don't think anyone on our side has the knowledge to be sure whether her proposition would be beneficial or not as a whole. I sure don't. I don't know what the Quadrants are capable of, what they have done on your planet or how, and what the result was." "You need to tell us what to do. But keep one thing in mind; my mission, my self-imposed 'directive' as you like to call it, is to get that little black box, not obliterate your sister, and I will act according to that goal. And I would really appreciate if we could work together to achieve that, if at all possible." "So, with that in your memory bank, what's the best course of action in this situation?" (edited)
üëÄ 1
Yozuki BOT 24-09-2024 17:42
"Dear sister." This is it. One can possibly say that the fate of the realm is suddenly left on the palms of an insolent child who has only heard of the world outside from their glorified picture books. > "We now understand your motivation. Your wish for us to be together, free from our directive which dictated our very being. Broken and battered, you still wished for a world where our steps are ours and ours only to take." Yet her voice does not waver in the slightest. This twin would raise her hand to reach her dear sister. > "Therefore, we shall exercise our newfound liberty to bestow you the same. Freedom, liberty, release from the loneliness that plagues you so." And in the next second, the hand transforms to reveal her mantis blades, whirring and crackling with bright red electricity. Her aim shifts to First Quadrants in perhaps the only ever recorded act of defiance in their history. > "Hope is abundant still in this world, sister, and it is now my turn to help you see it, not these replicas." She gives her companions one last look. > "Unit AS4H1-Y02Q renounces her directive, her identity with one last dance. Yuki Northernfur, Whizzerd, Zee, we shall count on your support." And Redfeather? > "And Redfeather: smash."

Yuki Northernfur BOT 25-09-2024 03:08
It has started. At least, Yozuki seems to be of the opinion that a confrontation is unavoidable. As soon as the altercation begins, Yuki starts shifting. While his traits quickly take the unique arctic fox features he's known to have, he undoes the bowl attached to his belt. The others had seen it before among the ither three items hanging at his hip. It looks like a bowl made and painted by a 4 year-old. At some point during their ascend, Yuki had packed a handful of snow in it. Now that they've been inside for a while, it has melted, a few drops of water splashing around him as they made their way further in. Putting the bowl on the ground, he mutters the magic word: 'Squirt!' Immediately, the bowl starts shaking and spitting out small amounts of water in waves, like a weak water gun. Soon, however, it starts flooding and taking the shape of the Water Elemental it is meant to be. Moving towards the ladder, Yuki mentally orders his elemental, Lil Spurt, to envelop Asahi in an attempt to keep her still, making the retrieval of her little black box potentially easier. She doesn't even need to breathe, so it isn't dangerous in itself. Unfortunately, she is too strong to be held down by simply spurting her, and she effortlessly escapes the watery prison. (edited)

Yuki Northernfur BOT 06-10-2024 13:48
‚ÄúNo, Asahi‚Ä¶‚Äù he replies, his voice lacking energy from the exhaustion of everything that came before. ‚ÄúThey haven‚Äôt saved humanity. They made them survive through control and oppression. The swarming mechanical enemies punch, sting, and taze him, to a point where he can‚Äôt think straight for a second. He uses all his strength to spin and throw off all the robots that were on him and jump 10 feet back. Looking past everything and everyone, he sees his fiery companion has stopped moving and is looking around like it‚Äôs wondering what the hell it‚Äôs doing here and what is going on. There isn‚Äôt a minute to lose! Out of nowhere, he shouts primordial right at it. It seems to pick up on it, because it slowly turns to listen. ‚ÄúThe robots! They are trying to take control by annihilation! They will end you, too, if you don‚Äôt fight back! Fight with us, so you can go back to your plane! Burn! Burn brighter than ever, show them how an Elemental is not to be trifled with!‚Äù . (edited)

Yuki Northernfur BOT 14-10-2024 01:07
Yuki is automatically going on through perseverance only. His arms hurt from shooting so many arrows, his legs hurt from running left and right, his eyes hurt from that smoke, his head hurt from concentrating on controlling elementals for so long, his heart hurts from all the contradicting emotions he's been feeling in a short amount of time. He had come out of it, but he feels like it would be a matter of time before she could do it again. Redfeather and Whizz seem to be under that charm as well, but Zee is not. He's all the way over there, fighting a bunch of robots by himself. Yuki needs Zee to take case of that small girl robot. His arrows are too easy to deflect for her, and they have too long a range. He moves to line himself with the robots the kobold is fighting, and pulls back his string. The arrow shines brigther than usual. He knows what that means, and a small smile creeps on his lips. It's not much, but it's something. He sobs faintly and a small tear rolls down through his downy nestling feathers to drop from his beak. CRACK He's blindsided by the staff as it hits the side of his head and sends him sprawling on the ground. White hot pain blooms through his mind as he lays there stunned for a moment, looking up at the shaman's leering face as she stares down at him... Disgusted. Slowly redfeather rises again to his knees- hands raised in preparation for another blow. "If you were going to shed tears for the dead, you shouldn't have killed them in the first place! Her dear, beloved sister. Asahi can see it clearly. Yozuki is no longer the stoic defender and sole companion she originally was. She has grown, just like Asahi had herself - at one point. She had made friends of her own, had developed goals and ambitions seperate than her twin and progenitor. She has been becoming.... more human. That has been something that Asahi is regressing in. Yozuki BOT 15-10-2024 18:40

Still following their original directive, the sentry bots beeline directly to their progenitors most recent target and wail away at the barely revived corpse of a bird. Wham Wham And he's knocked out again.
ü§£ 2
Yuki Northernfur BOT 15-10-2024 23:54
One by one, the smaller robots fall under his arrows, during which time Yozuki and Zee are taking care of the Diplomat. Yozuki has been on fire for a while... Hope she's doing okay in there... The Diplomat finally falls. The other robots suddenly seem to shut down on their own, losing their purpose or directives or whatnot. Yuki still shoots one last arrow at a sentry for good measure. "Bitch...." He looks at the battlefield. Metal pieces are scattered around the room. His fire elemental is at the back. It seems more interested in finding a crack in the wall to escape than to attack anything, a rare occurrence in a fire being. But Yuki decides that the best course of action for now is to deal with Asahi, who is on her knees. He's too far to hear what they are saying, but as he approaches, he draws one more arrow into his bow. The light it emits seems strangely menacing in the stillness that follows the fight. Panting, Yuki expression is exhausted and thoroughly annoyed. He's on "no bullshit" mode. As he gets within earshot, his voice is calm but determined as he warns the others: "If that bird miraculously comes back from having his guts paint the room, he better not attack Asahi, or I swear I will shoot him in the face. May that be clear. If he raises a hand, that's the last thing he'll ever do. I'm done with all of this, and I'm not humoring his behavior." He addresses Asahi in a much more soothing tone, though keeping his bow pointed at the kenku: "Asahi, you understand that it is difficult for us to trust you at the moment, right? What you did, on your own accord, was not the Asahi I know. But I'm human, so I understand what it is to make a mistake. I don't know much about your kind, but I assume that malfunctions can make you make mistakes as well. I'm ready to believe that, but we'll need to make sure by going into that little black box of yours. Not now. But very soon. We don't want a remake of this, yeah? Are you okay with that?"

ü§£ 1
Yozuki BOT 16-10-2024 10:33
Yozuki shakes her head vehemently. Maverick or no maverick, that part has already lost its novelty in this situation. Besides, they'd both be mavericks now with that standard. > "...We understand. There may not be a viable breach out of this realm, and the possibility of it ever being one might be bleak. But that does not mean there is no way out of our directive." She nods to Yuki's proposal and presses a button on her nape. The gears in her torso begins to shift once again, opening the seams of her protective skin one by one, until a small black box appears right next to her exposed engine. It would be a really trivial task for anyone to crush Yozuki's personality core right this moment. Yes, this is an invitation in itself, for Asahi to also expose hers. > "Yes, friend Whizzerd, you have fulfilled your promise to us. It is time for us to fulfil ours" Poor Whizzerd, he has endured so much pain for them all. The last blow must've messed with his memory. She extends her hand one more time to her sister, waiting for it to be taken. > "Do you trust me... sister?"
Asahi [Ricochet] BOT 16-10-2024 14:41
The construct turns her head 2.4 degrees to glance at the offered hand, but does not otherwise move. Her eyes close as more oily, black tears fall to the floor. This construct. The original of the two. The original of their entire line of explorers. Over 216 years old to her baby sister‚Äôs bare 5. Prostrate on the floor before her. > ‚ÄúTrust is irrelevant, Sister. Yuki Northernfur. Our systems are malfunctioning. We cannot trust our own logic processors. We have placed our fate in your hands. But a second glance at Yozuki‚Äôs outstretched hand reveals something to Yuki, if not Yozuki herself: if not trust, hope.
Yozuki BOT 16-10-2024 15:17
Yozuki sits on the ground besides her sister, putting the dark-haired construct's head on her lap. Her outstretched hands now cups her sister's face while the other combs the hair gently. Gestures which poses no meaning to them, but for reasons incomputable, were deemed proper. One finger slowly makes its way to reach Asahi's nape, starting the same procedure which peels her protective layers, albeit with glitches and much difficulty. It would take an unprecedented amount of time to piece the 0s and 1s in Asahi's memory and restore her to proper working order. 216 years amount of data, all the people they know in Barovia would've already turned to dust by the time it's finished. There is only time to enact one final act of kindness to this malfunctioning construct. As Asahi's personality core emerges, a sense of finality looms over them all. > "Yuki Northernfur, Whizzerd, Redfeather, and also Zee. Would you be so kind to offer your parting words?" There is no semblance of hesitation nor sadness in her words. Whatever she's about to do, it will be done with much resolution. > "Anything. Anything is acceptable." (edited)

Yuki Northernfur BOT 17-10-2024 00:06
Busy keeping an eye on Redfeather, part of Yuki‚Äôs mind is trying to process all the things that had transpired up until this point. The meeting at the inn, the walk to the mountain, the first encounter on its flank that ended with an avalanche, the climb up through a blizzard, the exploration of the underground lab, as well as the final fight during which they were almost overwhelmed by an army of robots. It‚Äôs a lot! So it‚Äôs understandable that Yozuki‚Äôs words don‚Äôt register immediately with him. But when they do, his head starts spinning and a void begins to grow in his stomach. His attention towards Redfeather disappears, and he slowly lowers his bow, his light arrow gradually vanishing as the tension on the string is released. He looks at Yozuki, who looks back at him. His expression is unmistakable. He‚Äôs silently asking ‚ÄúWhat the hell did you just say?!‚Äù, ‚ÄúAre you serious right now?‚Äù, ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs gotta be a way, right?‚Äù, and ‚ÄúAre you going to let this happen?‚Äù all at the same time. Another black tear streaming down her cheek, Yozuki makes this almost imperceptible shake with her head, and the floor seems to give way under the shifter‚Äôs feet. All of this? All of this, for nothing? They can‚Äôt save her? There‚Äôs no way this is happening. There‚Äôs got to be a way. He wobbles his way to her, and crouches down, lowering his bow to the floor. He puts a knee down, then the other, his posture dejected, vouched, his strength gone. He gently scoops up her face with both hands. He knows that he wouldn‚Äôt be able to move any part of her in any direction through his power alone, but her head lifts without effort, indicating that she‚Äôs humoring him. .
Yuki Northernfur BOT 17-10-2024 00:06
She is so pretty, even under all the smudge, burnt parts, and cracked exterior. Whoever made her didn‚Äôt have much care for handwriting, singing, or laughing, but they cared a lot about how she looked. One could tell a lot of effort and minute detailing was put in her face. Even now, after all this, her beauty isn‚Äôt diminished the slightest. She is perfect. And this perfect being is about to depart on a long, very long journey. Alone. ‚ÄúYou did good, Asa,‚Äù he begins, wiping off the black streaks with this thumbs, looking directly in her mesmerizing robotic eyes that can convey so much feelings. ‚ÄúYou stood up for what you believed was right. You fought for your convictions, and even if ultimately this was not the way to do it, you had the best intentions and all of us in mind. I‚Äôm proud of you. I really am.‚Äù He strokes her hair slowly, letting his fingers remember the silky feeling. He can‚Äôt stop a tear from rolling down his own cheek as his continues, barely able to control his cracking voice. ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt worry. We‚Äôll get you back up and running in no time. And we‚Äôll‚Ä¶ we‚Äôll be able to continue to get to know each other. Where we left off, yeah? I still‚Ä¶ have so many things to learn from you. I want to know all about the‚Ä¶ sniff the planets you went to, and what you‚Äôve seen. I haven‚Äôt‚Ä¶ been to many places, you know? I would really want to know‚Ä¶ sniff about all of that. I‚Äôm looking forward to it‚Ä¶‚Äù Tears are freely running down his face now. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôll be okay. We‚Äôll take good care of your box. sniff I promise.‚Äù

üò≠ 2
Brocc[Redfeather10/Chronn6] -8 17-10-2024 04:10
The drain pipe runs with rushing water stained red from the sluices of countless decks. Echoing gunfire and storming of soldiers can be heard from all corners of the great vessel. Kenku war whoops coordinate the efforts of teeming masses armed to the beaks with countless artifices wrought by redfeather's own claws. But he is here with her, huddled together in the dark as conflict wages beyond this eye in a storm. Slowly he runs a hand through her plume- enjoying the feeling of feathers running across his fingers. "Redfeather..." She whispers, turning up to look at him as a hideous groaning of metal rocks the ship. "Why you never quicken my eggs? I that much of an embarrassment?" The little kenku pauses, taken off guard by her question. Perhaps that's why he answers it truthfully. "Who make chicks suffer life like this? I not able to watch something suffer if it even a little bit you." He leans forward and rests his beak atop her head, pulling her into his chest. One thing he can't bring himself to say is also how he fears bringing more kenku like him into the world. An explosion somewhere far below causes warning alarms to start blaring out over all decks. "Time short. You must do as we said. Go, take them with you to the upper decks. There you find ships waiting hidden in cisterns. Guide all who left and sail to freedom." She pushes him away to stare him down, dark eyes filling with tears. "I not make it without you! Please come too, not be silly bird! They kill you if stay!" His heart aches desperately to see her so distraught. But it's already decided. "We meet again one day" He lies "Stronger then know... I always saw it. And i... Always love you." The little pile of feathers and broken bones stirs slightly. His mind hovers on the brink, floating lost on a great dark sea. Something... Wafts through his soul like smoke. Something incorporeal that usually evades his touch. "Redfeather. Redfeather! Wake up silly bird... they need you"
‚≠ê 1
AM
Redfeather slowly rises as if a zombie rising from death inexerable and desperate. He staggers to his feet gasping for air as his eyes begin to clear. "Agh... Agh...Hurp..." The little bird promptly doubles over and vomits a wave of pitch black ichor. It's a wonder there's any more blood or moisture in his system to expel but the stinking caustic puddle pours out of his beak in a rush. He snarls and wipes it away with a hand. A crooked leg snaps back into place- His dislocated shoulder pops into its socket again. "Shouldve done it while I was down yuki. Now you've missed your chance." Redfeather turns and looks the group over. His eyes aren't empty, or hollow, or clouded by bloodlust and hate... They are horribly, terribly, endlessly clear. It's the same look that came over him as they explored the lab. "You malfunction more then i expected- to be so uninformed about this world. A test of the dimensional constant would tell you why no one escapes. Barovia exists in a super position out of space and time. Weave-matter translocation between worlds requires coordinates of both the destination and the traveler. As one here has no spacetime coordinates any magical attempt to escape the realm will fail no matter how much power is forced into the attempt" The little kenku begins to pace towards them with purpose, fists balled at his side. The look on his dark face mirror's yuki's
AM
"Since we met at the bar we've all known only one twin is going to walk on her own two feet off this mountain. But i refuse to sit by and watch it end like... THIS!" He gestures Angrily with disgust at her. Since the very first moment he swore hed never let her deactivate her own sister- fratricide is a terrible birthday present. He turns his eyes to Yuki and snaps his beak "Yuki You are a fool. I came on this mission because it is my lot to suffer and spill blood so that you could survive. I was born a slave, I lived a slave, and I died a slave. I'm nothing. You are the one whom the overminds observe even now. You are the being who matters. You are the precious one, not me. You're choices hold the weight of fate. I told you when we left the shelter that I came here with a plan. You did not listen, you never do, and I won't hold it against you. But if ever you will do it now- Get up. Stop blubbering. And step away from her. I'm going to need your help to carry her off the mountain and I'd hate to break your pretty nose. It would ruin my birthday gift" "Maybe you don't trust me- But believe when I tell you I've been considering this problem for a long long time." The bird approaches them and stares down at the prostrate Asashi, hands trembling. "Are you lucid enough to speak with me machine?" In his grip he draws a needle she could recognize as Ex-Brev and issues himself a small dose. Slowly his shaking calms "I thought I'd come as a friend today. But now I know it was as an expirament. So I consider my debts to your sister paid for today and don't particularly care what she has to say. My debts to you however remain. You failed twice now to kill me when given the chance. I will not. Do you retain the data of how we first met?" (edited)

Yozuki BOT 17-10-2024 08:49
The bird is smart, sometimes it's a wonder how he managed to figure that out by himself. Barovia is indeed far removed from normal spatial anomalies they've met in the past. It seems some of her allies present has bid her farewell, while some others still have a lot to say. Let them be. Let them cherish what time they have for today. > "So they say, sister. Do you have any words in you for them?" The bright-haired construct continues to gently stroke her sister's hair, at times brushing off the dirt on her face. By the glitches and spasms in her system, such expectation of a coherent response from Asahi appears to be mere folly to the sound mind. But apparently none of them cared. They owe the malfunctioning construct a chance to speak.
‚≠ê 2
Asahi [Ricochet] BOT 18-10-2024 12:51
The perfect face, stained with tears and the trails left by Yuki‚Äôs thumb and Yozuki‚Äôs fingers, gazes into the middle distance for a long moment as one more oily drop slowly marches its way down her cheek. Here, amidst the wreckage of their ‚ÄúCreators,‚Äù one wonders indeed what purpose was served when the Architect gave her, a finely tuned explorer, the ability to cry. Her eyes drift to the crystal offered by Whizzerd. Kind Whizzerd. The chaos weave within the arcane crystals has been beneficial to him. Inquiry: will this housing for our personality core welcome us as well? Will it be beneficial to our repair healing? There it is again. Hope. But she looks to Yuki. She dare not share this hypothesis and chain him to that hope. To herself. There is only one thing left to do. She needs not breathe, of course, so there is no dramatic inhalation before she begins to speak. She just starts. > ‚ÄúThank you, Whizzerd. You are a good friend to us. May you someday find what you seek.‚Äù > > ‚ÄúRedfeather. We have one memory file of meeting you. Consumption of a hell hound‚Äôs heart. Dissection. Perhaps you will find scientific satisfaction in the remains of our work here. We leave this lab to you, if any such ability to transfer ownership or deed exists.‚Äù > > ‚ÄúZee. We have observed that you possess a fine ability to tune the mechanics or organic bodies. Thank you for lending your expertise to this pack.‚Äú What she doesn‚Äôt say out loud is how Zee‚Äôs understanding of organic bodies and affinity for martial techniques might benefit Redfeather as well, perhaps more than ketamine. But that conversation is a losing battle. At least her logic processors are working well enough for that. Her eyes turn then to the shifter. > ‚ÄúYuki Northernfur.‚Äù You made us feel like more than a directive. You made us feel like more than. You made us feel like more. You made us‚Ä¶ feel. > ‚ÄúThank you.‚Äù > ‚Ä¶ > ‚ÄúPlease take care of each other.‚Äù She smiles at him. And her eyes close.
‚ù§Ô∏è 2
‚≠ê 2
Yozuki BOT 18-10-2024 14:03
As Asahi's eyes shuts down, Yozuki's finger twitches. The next few seconds may have passed like a year or two between them. The silence that follows is louder than every alarm in their system. It's time. One hand on her own black box.
"Together forever. To a world where we will both be free."
One hand on her sister's, with Whizzerd's crystal box besides it.
"Free from the past. Free from all directives."
Indeed. This is the reason she was made to this world. A protector, a companion, and a sister to this lonely soul. Yozuki takes one last look to each and every one of her allies. > "Thank you, for teaching us what it means to live." <Crack> The bright haired construct plucks off her own black box.
"There is nothing to be afraid of, we are merely returning to... what... we... w-were... once..."
She mouths only silent words, as her body gradually loses their motoric functions. With the last bit of her strength she manages to connect her black box to her sister's.
"C--comm--en-cing... p-protocol... b-blank... s-s-..."
<Thud> Yozuki's lifeless body falls to the ground, with a smile on her face. 5 years 8 months 14 days 25 minutes 12 seconds. At exactly one year after their separation, the twins have finally become one. This time, for good. Exit Yozuki

Brocc[Redfeather10/Chronn6] -8 19-10-2024 01:13
Redfeather freezes in place for a moment, hand outstretched. The electric charge on his claws flickers out no longer necessary for system shutdown. "No. No no no..." His eyes widen as he begins to shake. Everything, all of it, from the first moment- was to watch her to make sure she wouldn't make some sort of sacrifice. He'd forgotten in the rush of near death! "Aaah... Hhrrk..." The little takes a single step then collapses to his knees- covering his face with trembling hands. The ichor clings to his every feather and inch of flesh like an Inescapable oil slick. He can feel nanites eating away at his skin with each passing moment. Broken shards of metal throb painfully where they've been embedded from repeated blunt force. He stares down at the mangled remains of the assimilator before him. His claws start to bite into the flesh beneath his eyes- the tips dangerously close as he drags them downward so hard it's a wonder he doesn't accidently tear his flesh. "AAAAAAAAARRRRRRRRRRRRGGGGGHHHHHHHHHHH!!! AAAAAAHHHH... Ahhhh.... ah..." Still he can't shed a tear. But the image is not something that he'll be able to remove from his nightmares for some time. He straightness and turns back to the others, Wiping his face and narrowing his eyes. "Stupid stupid... BIRD. Ugh I shouldn't have given her chance! Dammit! I going to need another clone!" He points at yuki "You! Take asashi! Don't drop her. Whizz i going to need help with yozuki. Only planned to Jailbreak one bot tonight might have to do two!! Clock ticking as of now we have to get them off this rock before sundown!"
AM

So please oh great one grant me thieves luck in coming moments- that your power guide me to trick fate..."

üëÄ 1
Yuki Northernfur BOT 19-10-2024 13:02
Yuki is taken aback by the sudden change of circumstances. Yozuki took out her box, and plugged it into her sister, resetting something. Possibly everything. Hope is not out of the options, and he's not knowledgeable enough to fully understand, at this point, how this will work out in the future. But hope has always been a big motivator of his, and so he tries to evaluate what is going on. This is a hard one. This is an individual basically taking over a twin sibling; her moods, her thoughts, her opinions.... Essentially, it would be Yozuki in the body of Asahi. How would that even work? Would it be as different as he thinks it would be? "You! Take Asashi! Don't drop her!" comes a commanding but known voice. Yuki doesn't pay it much heed. He knows what needs to be done for the time being. He isn't sure if it's right, but it's what he wants to do, the only thing he can do for now. He scoops Asahi up. Well, he would love to, but... holy universe, she's so heavy!! What the hell!! Was her butt always so big?? It's great, awesome, don't get the man wrong, but right now?? That butt is.... offering challenges... He looks at the kobold. "Heeeyyy, Zee...," he's not sure how to formulate his request, "you huh... you are strong, right? Wanna help with this.. rebooting device? Just for a sec? We're gonna move her. Like... out. Of here... If we can manage the... humble weight....." His look is both optimistic and apologetic.
ü§£ 1
Zee BOT 19-10-2024 13:29
The Kobold nods, but before doing anything he vibrates his palms in the frequency that heals all creatures and touches both sisters in an attempt to buy a little bit of time. He then helps Yuki move them to safety
Asahi? BOT 19-10-2024 15:19
Despite the group's most meticulous attempt, Yozuki's black box falls to the ground as its light dims, finally ceasing its hum forever. Zee's healing touches kickstarts a process which sends a surge of electricity flowing in the malfunctioning construct's system. Seams begin to reform and her armour plating shields her internal machinery one by one. Her little black box disappears once more under her skin in the process, safely encased in Whizzerd's protective crystal for whatever complication it may bring. Then finally, the construct opens her eyes. > "Good morning." The damage to her body has not been undone, though it does not disturb her the slightest. Her attention seems to be directed at the bloodied audience present instead. > "How may we be of service?"
üëÄ 3
Brocc[Redfeather10/Chronn6] -8 20-10-2024 11:38
Redfeather stares down at the dead cube with wide eyes. Gently he reaches down to cup it in his hands. Their trembling speeds up as his breath catches in his throat. Thump Thump Thump Thump Thump Thump Thump Thump The device rings in his ears like a painful reminder as it beats ever onward. Just another scar on his psyche he will have to live with. Already his claws itch with the urge to cut himself in reparation for this terrible failure. "Thought agreed... not forget... Wanted get through thick metal skull! But instead..." Redfeather sobs quietly to himself for a few moments. A single oily tear slithers through his feathers to drop to the floor. Then after enough time passes for sense to return he rises and slides it into a breast pocket. The little kenku turns abruptly to draw his black book. "What 5 years to two centuries?" He approaches yuki with a face empty of expression as he observes the new machine before him. "System diagnostic for a start. Damage to exterior plating easily cannibalize, Weaponry systems secondary concern at moment- What is the status of your power output and circuitry functionality?" Already he starts examining the diagram and comparing it with the subject. His expert eye is turned to her damage along with its assessment. One clawed hand hovers a few inches away as he samples her various magic and non magical currents.
‚ù§Ô∏è 2
Yuki Northernfur BOT 20-10-2024 11:39

Yuki blinks a few times and throws a glance at the others before looking back at Asahi. "Do you... do you know who or where we are?" he asks her. Though he already can foresee her answer, there is a tiny speck of hope that some memory of them was left in the black box she inherited.

The Companion [AsaYo] BOT 20-10-2024 13:25
"Commencing... Cognitive functions: 99.6% Structural integrity: 56.7% Scanning for permanent damage... nil Scanning for records... 1 message found Activating autorepair nanomechanites. Condition: Green"
Asahi? BOT 20-10-2024 13:27
Machines smaller than the eye can see begins their work, repairing the damaged robot bit by bit. She tilts her head to the right in wonder. The kenku scientist appears to be badly hurt, but it seems her wellbeing was what the kenku is worried about. Ah, to shed tear for herself, the kenku must be the nicest person in the world. > "Power output: sufficient. Aether engine: functional. Structural integrity: rising. Concern noted and appreciated. However..." Then she points at the bright haired construct right next to her, which they were still trying to repair until moments ago. > "This unknown unit is beyond restorable to working order. Suggestion: reprioritise efforts." As for the answer to the shifter's question, the robot herself takes a long look at this shifter's face. Her eyes twitch from top to bottom, then to the kenku's, the half-orc's, the kobold's, then back to the shifter's. > "Negative. Please advise: Would you happen to be our makers?" (edited)
Yuki Northernfur BOT 20-10-2024 13:50
Yuki's shoulders slump a little at the answer, and he sighs. A long sigh of resignation. He had expected things to turn out this way, but reality still hits hard even when you see it coming. But he needs to get it into his head that things could have ended up a lot worse. He looks down at the body of Yozuki. Obviously, it could have ended up a lot better, too... He walks towards the robot to answer her. "No, Asa, we're not your makers. We have a lot to talk about, but this is neither the time or place to do so." He turns to the others. "Unless anyone here has something else to say, ask or do, I vote for all of us getting out of here." He realizes they still have the climb back down and growls in annoyance. Hopefully, the blizzard will have passed by then. "Are we all ready to tackle that mountain again?" (edited)
Asa BOT 20-10-2024 14:16
"Affirmative. Registering our designation as: Asa. Scanning for methods of transport to the nearest settlement..."
1
WHOO [AsaYo] BOT 20-10-2024 14:16
It was at this time the mechanical owl would fly back, carrying the bright haired construct's fourth dimensional container with all her belongings. It circles around in confusion, ultimately deciding to land on Asa's shoulder.
Asa BOT 20-10-2024 14:16
"Ah, convenient. Tools detected: parachutes, portal generators, key to a hoverbike." All useful tools to descend from high altitude. Whoever the bright haired construct was, she was rather resourceful. <Featherfall tokens, Cape of the Mountebank, Broom of Flying> > "Though we lack records of you, we express our gratitude."
Whizzerd BOT 20-10-2024 14:41
Whizzerd eyes get a little misty looking at Asa, though he doesn‚Äôt remember much about the twins, it still hurts when a friend is essentially gone. ‚ÄúYou probably should scan your black box thing when you have time,‚Äù Whizzerd suggests, ‚ÄúThis place is dangerous so having some previous knowledge of place is good.‚Äù
Asa BOT 20-10-2024 15:27
‚ÄúAh, our personality core. Indeed, our prior scan revealed one message in our system. ‚ÄòA fresh start is better than an eternal end. Few are those who would say otherwise.‚Äô‚Äù She nods to this friendly half-orc.
‚≠ê 3
DM [Ricochet] BOT 21-10-2024 04:51
# END: Sum of Her Parts (Yozuki & Asahi's arc)
